Zephyr Shield.title: Zephyr Shield
Zephyr Shield.description: Your Flying-Type Pokémon may activate Zephyr Shield as a Standard Action Interrupt, or as a Shift Action during their turn. If they do, until the end of the user's next turn, all ranged attacks targetting them take a -1 penalty to Accuracy and -10 penalty to damage, they become immune to the effects of Moves with the Powder keyword, and they do not lose Hit Points from Weather effects. Additionally, if Zephyr Shield is used as a Standard Action, that Pokémon may use the Resolution Effect of a Flying-Type Move with the Set- Up keyword on their next turn, skipping the Set-Up phase.

World of Darkness.title: World of Darkness

fields.value: Shade Caller, Adept Guile or Stealth
fields.name: Prerequisites

World of Darkness.description: You create a zone of Shifting Darkness in a Burst 2 around you, which persists until the end of the en- counter. All targets without Darkvision attacking from or i nto the Shifting Darkness receive a -3 penalty to Ac- curacy. You may count Shifting Darkness as complete darkness for the purposes of activating your Living Shadow. As a Static effect, you also gain the Darkvision Capability.

Words of Power.title: Words of Power

fields.value: Adept Occult Education, Hidden Power Static
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You or your Pokémon use Hidden Power
fields.name: Trigger

Words of Power.description: Instead of a Burst, you may choose to have Hidden Power be a 1 Target Melee, 1 Target 6m, or Cone 2. Additionally, you and your Prime Unown always have STAB on Hidden Power as if you or they were of the same Type.

Witch Hunter.title: Witch Hunter

fields.value: Occultism Research Field, Novice Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Witch Hunter.description: You gain the "Psionic Sight" Feature, even if you do not meet the prerequisites. If you already had the Psionic Sight Feature, you instead gain another Feature for which you qualify.

Winter's Herald.title: Winter's Herald

fields.value: Frost Touched, Expert Athletics or Survival
fields.name: Rank 1 Prerequisites

Winter's Herald.description: You may learn two Moves from the list below, marked with the Rank of Winter's Herald you are gaining or lower.

fields.value: Frost Touched, Master Athletics or Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Wind Runner.title: Wind Runner

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Flying), Novice Acrobatics, Novice Perception
fields.name: Prerequisites

Wind Runner.description: You gain the Levitate Ability. You have a total Levitate Speed equal to 4 plus half of the higher of your Acrobatics or Perception Rank.

Wilderness Guide.title: Wilderness Guide
Wilderness Guide.description:
Wilderness Guide's effect depends on your current terrain.
» Grassland or Forest
» Ocean or Wetlands
» Desert or Tundra
» Mountain or Cave
» Urban

Well Read.title: Well Read
Well Read.description: You may use your General Education Rank to qualify for Books, instead of the Book's usual Skill Prerequisites, provided you have the normal Prerequisite at at least Novice Rank.

Weather Systems.title: Weather Systems

fields.value: Your Pokemon with at least 2 Tutor Point
fields.name: Target

Weather Systems.description: Your Pokemon loses 2 Tutor Points, and learns your choice of Hail, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, or Sunny Day. The target must be able to learn the chosen Move through Level-Up, TM, or Tutor Moves. If the target has the chosen Move in their Level-Up List, Weather Systems costs no Tutor Points.

Weapon Finesse.title: Weapon Finesse

fields.value: Counter Stance, Adept Combat or Acrobatics
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit a foe with a Weapon Attack.
fields.name: Trigger

Weapon Finesse.description: After the attack is resolved, you may immediate- ly use a Disarm, Trip, or Push Maneuver against that foe as a Free Action. The Maneuver automatically hits, but you must still make an Opposed Roll.

Water's Shroud.title: Water's Shroud
Water's Shroud.description: Choose Wash Away or Storm Drain. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Warping Ground.title: Warping Ground
Warping Ground.description: You learn the Moves Gravity and Trick.

Warper.title: Warper
Warper.description: You gain the Probability Control Ability.

Warped Transmission.title: Warped Transmission

fields.value: You activate the Teleporter Capability or use the Move Ally Switch
fields.name: Trigger

Warped Transmission.description: All adjacent foes to the square you end in after teleporting or using Ally Switch have their Evasion lowered by 3 for one full round and cannot trigger Attacks of Opportunity against you for Shifting until the end of your next turn.

Wall of Iron.title: Wall of Iron
Wall of Iron.description: You learn the moves Iron Defense and Protect.

Walk It Off.title: Walk It Off
Walk It Off.description: Remove one Injury from yourself and regain 1/4th of your maximum Hit Points. This Injury removal doesn't count against the natural healing limit on Injuries each day.

Voice Lessons.title: Voice Lessons
Voice Lessons.description: You and your Pokémon's Moves with the Sonic keyword gain the Friendly keyword. Voice Lessons may not affect the Move Perish Song. Additionally, whenever your Pokémon use a Move with the Sonic Keyword in a Contest, they may roll +1d6.

Vim and Vigor.title: Vim and Vigor

fields.value: Shrug Off, Master Athletics or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
fields.name: Trigger

Vim and Vigor.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and gains the Vigor Ability.

Vile Body.title: Vile Body
Vile Body.description: Choose Absorb Force, Poison Point, or Poison Touch. You gain the chosen Ability.

Versatile Wardrobe.title: Versatile Wardrobe

fields.value: Fashionista, two Fashionista Skills at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
fields.name: Target

Versatile Wardrobe.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and then becomes chic. Chic Pokémon gain two extra Held Item slots with which they can carry Held Items. However, the items in these slots have no effect and are not treated as equipped. As a Swift Action on their turn, Chic Pokémon may swap a currently active Held Item with an item stored in these slots. Chic Pokémon may not carry multiple items of the same type or with repeated effects.

Vampirism.title: Vampirism

fields.value: Ghost Step, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits an adjacent foe with a Ghost-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Vampirism.description: Choose a Stat. The triggering foe loses a Tick of Hit Points and a Combat Stage in that Stat. Your Pokémon gains 1 Combat Stage in the chosen Stat, and a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.

Utility Drop.title: Utility Drop
Utility Drop.description: You may use a Smoke Ball, Caltrops, or Toxic Caltrops as a Free action during your Shift. Instead of the Move's usual area of effect, you leave one square of Smokescreen, Spikes, or Toxic Spikes on each square you leave as you Shift. Once you place 8 meters of Smoke, Spikes, or Toxic Spikes you may not place any more.

Usurper.title: Usurper

fields.value: You have slain a God and through occult ritual or technology have absorbed its essence.
fields.name: Prerequisites

Usurper.description: Your human form is now considered your Avatar, and you gain a second set of stats for your Pokémon form. This form is that of the Legendary you usurped, starts at level 1 with the nature and abilities of your choice, and may gain experience as if it were a Pokémon you owned. Switching between your human form and this one takes a Standard Action. Usurpers cannot receive Gifts or Blessings from other Legendaries, as they are divinity themselves now. Any Touched, Branded, Messiah, and Signer Edges and Features you possessed up until this point are refunded. The Patron Stats for this Feature and all other Usurper Features matches the stats of the Legendary you Usurped.

Upheaval.title: Upheaval

fields.value: Mold the Earth, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses the Groundshaper Capability, or a Move with the Groundsource keyword
fields.name: Trigger

Upheaval.description: Your Pokémon may make a Trip Attempt as a Free Action against any Pokémon targeted by the Move, or standing on a square changed by the Groundshaper capability. Your Pokémon gains a bonus to their Combat Roll equal to half of your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Upgrader.title: Upgrader

fields.value: Upgrader Research Field, Novice Medicine Edu, Novice Technology Edu
fields.name: Prerequisites

Upgrader.description: You may craft any Augmentation Recipe for which you qualify and install them on yourself and willing Pokémon and Trainers.

Unveiled Sight.title: Unveiled Sight
Unveiled Sight.description: You can see through Illusions. This means you can spot Illusions from the Illusionist capability, Illusion Ability, and Genjutsu Feature as being fake. You are immune to Moves with the Illusion keyword, Double Team cannot be activated against you, and you bypass Substitutes. As a Standard Action, you can create a Burst 4, dispelling all Illusion effects within.

fields.value: Slow or Steady, Expert Combat or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Unexpected Attacks.title: Unexpected Attacks

fields.value: Rogue, two Rogue Skills at Adept Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Unexpected Attacks.description: You learn the Moves Pursuit and Sucker Punch.

Underhanded Tactics.title: Underhanded Tactics

fields.value: Rogue, a Rogue Skill at Expert Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Underhanded Tactics.description: You gain your choice of Ambush or Cruelty.

Unconquerable.title: Unconquerable

fields.value: Tyrant’s Roar, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Dragon-Type Move while they have 3 or more Status Afflictions
fields.name: Trigger

Unconquerable.description: Your Pokémon is cured of up to three Status Afflictions.

Tyrant's Roar.title: Tyrant's Roar

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a Dragon-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Tyrant's Roar.description: Your Pokémon creates a Burst 2, Slowing all Foes in the area and causing those foes to lose 1 Combat Stage in any Stat in which they have positive Combat Stages

Type Sync.title: Type Sync

fields.value: Elemental Connection; a Type-Linked Class; Adept Medicine, Occult, or Tech Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Type Sync.description: The Target gains the Type of your Elemental Connection as an additional Type, or has one of their Types replaced by that Type. See the Type Changes section (page 436) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may be targeted by Type Sync only once. This Feature may be performed One Time for each Rank above Untrained you have of your highest of Medicine, Occult, or Tech Education, up to a maximum of 4 times at Master Rank.

Type Refresh.title: Type Refresh
Type Refresh.description: The target regains one use of a Scene-Frequency Move of your Chosen Type, and refreshes the Frequency of all EOT-Frequency Moves of your Chosen Type. A Target can be affected by Type Refresh only once per Scene.

Type Methodology.title: Type Methodology
Type Methodology.description:
Effects depend on whether your Pokémon has the Tolerance or Exploit ability:
» Whenever your Pokémon with Tolerance takes Super-Effective damage from a Tagged foe, your Pokémon may lose 2 Momentum to Resist that attack one step.
» Whenever your Pokémon with Exploit deals Resisted damage to a Tagged foe, your Pokémon may lose 2 Momentum to increase the effectiveness of the attack one step.

Type Expertise.title: Type Expertise

fields.value: Level 9, 3 Moves of the Chosen Type in your Move List
fields.name: All Ranks Prerequisites

Type Expertise.description: Each Rank, choose a Type of which you know at least 3 Moves. You gain STAB for the chosen Type. STAB is never applied to Struggle Attacks.

Type Ace.title: Type Ace

fields.value:
2 Different Pokémon of the chosen Type, Type-Linked Skill at Novice
OR
Elemental Connection (of the chosen Type), 1 Pokémon of the chosen Type, Type-Linked Skill at Novice
See the attached image for details on the Type-Linked Skills.
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining.
fields.name: Target

Type Ace.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns the Last Chance or Type Strategist Ability for your Chosen Type. You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.

Twisted Soul.title: Twisted Soul
Twisted Soul.description: You gain the effects of the old Twisted Power Ability: The user adds half of their Attack Stat to the damage rolls of their Special Moves; and the user adds half of their Special Attack Stat to the damage of their Physical Moves. This does not change the Damage Class of any attack.

Tutoring.title: Tutoring

fields.value: Novice Pokémon Education, a move that you or three of your Pokémon know
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: One Time Use x 3 — Extended Action
fields.name: Frequency

Tutoring.description: When activating this Feature, select a Move known either by yourself or by 3 Pokémon you own. This Move is Mastered. As an Extended Action, you may have Pokémon spend 2 Tutor Points to learn a Move you have Mastered. Pokémon targeted this way can only learn Moves that they could learn by Level Up, TM, Egg Move, or Move Tutor. You may take Tutoring multiple times, each time gaining 3 uses of the Feature

Tumbler.title: Tumbler
Tumbler.description: You gain the Run Away Ability.

True Steel.title: True Steel

fields.value: Polished Shine, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Steel-Type Pokémon is hit by a damaging attack
fields.name: Trigger

True Steel.description: Your Pokémon gains Damage Reduction against the attack equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank. Additionally, calculate Type Effectiveness with this attack as if your Pokémon has no Typings besides Steel.

True Power.title: True Power

fields.value: Shared Strengths Rank 2, Pokemon Form Level 40
fields.name: Prerequisites

True Power.description: You gain one of the Domains and its corresponding Legendary Aura associated with your Legendary Form. This Feature may be taken multiple times, but with the second time at Pokemon Form Level 60, and the third at Pokemon Form level 75.

Trickster Orders.title: Trickster Orders
Trickster Orders.description: You gain the Capricious Whirl and Dazzling Dervish Orders.

Trickster.title: Trickster

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Status-Class Move or a foe triggers your Pokémon's Hazard
fields.name: Trigger

Trickster.description: After the Move is resolved, your Pokémon may perform a Dirty Trick or Manipulate Maneuver on that foe as a Free Action. The Maneuver automatically hits, but the target must be in range for the chosen Maneuver. Use your own Guile to resolve Manipulate Rolls.

Trick Shot.title: Trick Shot
Trick Shot.description: While this Feature is Bound, decrease the Accuracy Roll of the target’s damaging ranged attacks by -2. The Critical Hit range of those attacks is increased by +3. This Feature does not affect Moves without an AC value.

Trapper.title: Trapper
Trapper.description:
You create a consumable item that creates 8 meters of Hazard within 6 meters. All 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of the Hazard. These Hazards cause foes that run into them to become Slowed until the end of their next turn and have an additional effect based on the terrain in which the item was made. When foes run into these Hazards, they are destroyed after their effects resolve. Pokémon and Trainers with Naturewalk for the terrains associated with a Hazard are immune to its effects. These items must be used the same day they are created or they lose all effect.
» Dust Trap — Grassland or Desert
» Tangle Trap — Forest or Wetlands
» Slick Trap — Ocean or Tundra
» Abrasion Trap — Mountain, Cave, or Urban

Training Regime.title: Training Regime
Training Regime.description:
You gain additional static bonuses based on your Trained Stats.
» Attack
» Defense
» Special Attack
» Special Defense
» Speed

Trail Blazer.title: Trail Blazer

fields.value: Brightest Flame, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Trail Blazer.description: Your Pokémon sets the ground aflame and leaves a Fire Hazard in each square it shifts through this round, up to a maximum of 8 squares. Anyone who begins or ends their turn on a Fire Hazard are Burned. Anyone that passes through a Fire Hazard loses a Tick of Hit Points. If a Ground, Rock, or Water-Type Move targets a square (or a target in a square) with Fire Hazard in them, the Fire Hazards are destroyed. All effects that destroy Hazards extinguish Fire Hazards. Trail Blazer may only be used once per Scene.

Traceur.title: Traceur – Urban Terrain
Traceur.description: The city is your jungle. You gain a +1 Bonus to your Jump Capabilities. Add half your Survival Rank to your Evasion against Push, Trip, and Attack of Opportunity Maneuvers.

Tough as Schist.title: Tough as Schist

fields.value: Gravel Before Me, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Tough as Schist.description: While this Feature is Bound, allied Stealth Rock Hazards within 4 meters of your Pokémon are not used when a foe triggers them unless you want them to be. Whenever the target takes Super-Effective Damage from a Water, Grass, Ground, Fighting, or Steel Type Attack, they may consume an allied Stealth Rock Hazard within 4 meters to create temporary armor that grants them Damage Reduction equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank for one full round.

Tough as Nails.title: Tough as Nails
Tough as Nails.description: You learn the Moves Endure and Slack Off.

Tough Tumble.title: Tough Tumble
Tough Tumble.description: Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Tough Stat from Poffins may activate Tough Tumble as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Tornado Charge.title: Tornado Charge
Tornado Charge.description: Your Pokémon gains 2 additional Standard Actions this turn. Your Pokémon may also Shift between taking each action, so long as their total Movement does not exceed their Movement Capabilities. All three of your Pokémon's Standard Actions this turn must be used to perform Zephyr Shield, or Flying-Type Moves with a Frequency of At-Will or EOT. Tornado Charge may be used only once per day per Pokémon.

Top Tier Berries.title: Top Tier Berries
Top Tier Berries.description:
You may grow additional Berries and Herbs, depending on the higher of your General Education or Survival Rank.
» Novice
» Adept
» Expert
» Master

Top Percentage.title: Top Percentage

fields.value: Your Pokémon levels up to a Level evenly divisible by 5
fields.name: Trigger

Top Percentage.description: Your Pokémon gains an extra Tutor Point. Top Percentage may be used on a single Pokémon a maximum of 4 times. Once a Pokémon has gained 4 Tutor Points in this way, increase each of that Pokémon's Base Stats by +1.

Too Spooky.title: Too Spooky
Too Spooky.description: Choose Pressure or Frighten. You gain the chosen Ability.

Tip the Scales.title: Tip the Scales
Tip the Scales.description: Your [Orders] with an At-Will Frequency instead target all allies within 10 Meters.

Thought Detection.title: Thought Detection
Thought Detection.description: You become aware of the number of living Humans or Pokémon within X meters of yourself; X is equal to your Focus Rank tripled. Pokémon or Trainers with the Mindlock Capability are not detected by this Ability. You may only use Thought Detection as long as you have the Telepathy Capability.

This Will Not Stand.title: This Will Not Stand

fields.value: Tyrant’s Roar, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Dragon-Type Pokémon takes a Critical Hit or Massive Damage
fields.name: Trigger

This Will Not Stand.description: Your Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage in each of Attack, Special Attack, and Speed. This Will Not Stand may trigger only once per Scene per Pokémon.

This One's Special, I Know It.title: This One's Special, I Know It
This One's Special, I Know It.description: The Pokémon is born with special qualities, determined by the GM. This Feature may be activated one time per Pokémon Education Rank above Untrained.

The Power of Aura.title: The Power of Aura
The Power of Aura.description: Each Rank, choose Scrappy or Aura Storm. You gain the Chosen Ability.

The Cold Never Bothered Me Anyway.title: The Cold Never Bothered Me Anyway
The Cold Never Bothered Me Anyway.description: You gain the Naturewalk (Tundra) Capability, are immune to being Frozen, and do not lose Hit Points from Hail.

Terrain Talent.title: Terrain Talent
Terrain Talent.description: Each Rank, you gain two Terrain Talents, chosen from the Terrains for which you gained Naturewalk from Survivalist.

Telepathic Warning.title: Telepathic Warning

fields.value: Telepathic Awareness, Expert Focus or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You or an Ally use an Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Telepathic Warning.description: You're able to give your allies heed of attacks. All allies that would be hit by the attack may take a Shift Action as an Interrupt to move out of the area of effect of the attack. Using this leaves discoverable Psychic Residue on each affected ally. You may only use Telepathic Warning as long as you have the Telepath Capability.

Telepathic Awareness.title: Telepathic Awareness
Telepathic Awareness.description: Choose Gentle Vibe or Telepathy. You gain the chosen Ability.

Telepath (Feature).title: Telepath (Feature)

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Psychic), Iron Mind, Novice Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

Telepath (Feature).description: You gain the Telepathy Capability for the rest of the scene.

Telekinetic Burst.title: Telekinetic Burst

fields.value: You hit with Psychic or use another Telekinetic Move
fields.name: Trigger

Telekinetic Burst.description:
The effect of this Feature depends on the Triggering Move.
» Kinesis
» Barrier
» Psychic
» Telekinesis

Tectonic Shift.title: Tectonic Shift

fields.value: Ground Out, Master Focus or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

Tectonic Shift.description: Pick two of Earthquake, Earth Power, or Sand Tomb. You learn the chosen Moves.

Taskmaster.title: Taskmaster

fields.value: You apply Brutal Training as a Training action
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value:
Hardened Pokemon receive the following benefits:
» They do not lose Hit Points from acting while Heavily Injured
» Injuries beyond the 5th do not lower their Maximum Hit Points
» If they have 1 or more injuries, they gain +1 to Critical Hit and Effect Range.
» If they have 3 or more injuries, they gain +1 Evasion and +5 to Initiative.
» If they have 5 or more injuries, they gain +5 Damage Reduction.
» If they have 7 or more injuries, they are immune to Loss of Hit Points (but not damage) from all effects.
» If they have 9 or more injuries, they resist all damage one step further.
fields.name: Mechanic – Hardened

Taskmaster.description: You may grant your Pokémon up to three injuries. If your Pokémon has at least one Injury, it becomes Hardened.

Targeted Profiling.title: Targeted Profiling
Targeted Profiling.description: On the target's next turn, they act as if they had the Mold Breaker Ability against all Pokémon and Trainers in your Profile Archive and gains a +2 bonus to Accuracy Rolls against these targets.

Tag In.title: Tag In

fields.value: Round Trip, Expert Acrobatics or Guile
fields.name: Prerequisites

Tag In.description: The next Pokémon you send out is treated as if the recalled Pokémon had used Baton Pass on it.

Symbolsight.title: Symbolsight
Symbolsight.description: For the next ten minutes, you see the world through the lens of Symbolsight. You may end this effect early as a Free Action.

Sword of Body and Soul.title: Sword of Body and Soul

fields.value: You use a damaging Aura Guardian Move against an adjacent foe
fields.name: Trigger

Sword of Body and Soul.description: You may have the triggering Move deal damage as if it was your choice of Physical or Special Classes. Regardless, add both your Attack and Special Attack Stats to the Damage Roll, and this attack ignores Damage Reduction. This does not stack with Twisted Power.

Swift Strikes.title: Swift Strikes

fields.value: 4 Skirmisher Features, Master Combat or Acrobatics
fields.name: Prerequisites

Swift Strikes.description: Use a Weapon Attack as if it had the Priority Key- word. If the Move already had the Priority Keyword, use it as if it had the Priority (Advanced) Keyword instead.

Swarmlord.title: Swarmlord

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Bug), Novice Survival, Novice Command
fields.name: Prerequisites

Swarmlord.description: Your powers begin to take a er either Arachnid's Embrace or Monarch's Embrace. Depending on your Embrace, you gain an Ability and Stat Tag. Whenever you gain a Swarmlord Feature, you gain the same Stat Tag.

Survivalist.title: Survivalist
Survivalist.description: Choose a Terrain in which you have spent at least three nights. You gain Naturewalk for that terrain and a +2 bonus to Athletics, Acrobatics, Stealth, Perception, and Survival Checks in that terrain. When you have 2 Sur- vivalist Features, you may choose a second Terrain. When you have 4 Survivalist Features, you may choose a third terrain. When you have 6 Survivalist Features, you may choose a fourth terrain.

Surprise!.title: Surprise!

fields.value: You make an attack against a foe that does not anticipate an attack or is adjacent to your Pokémon with Pack Hunt or Teamwork
fields.name: Trigger

Surprise!.description: Make two attack rolls for the triggering action, and use the better result to finalize the attack. If both attacks would hit, the target is Flinched. Surprise! may be used only once per Scene per target. If the triggering attack was a Poké Ball, Hand Net, Cap Cannon, or Struggle Attack, Surprise! costs 1 AP to activate; otherwise, it costs 2 AP.

Surefooted.title: Surefooted – Mountain Terrain
Surefooted.description: You’re not afraid of precarious ledges and steep hills. You gain a +2 Bonus to Skill Checks made to climb, balance, or maintain footing – including resisting Push and Trip maneuvers. Whenever you take falling damage, ignore one meter and receive one less Injury when determining damage.

Sunlight Within.title: Sunlight Within

fields.value: Foiling Foliage, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Sunlight Within.description: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Sunny Weather.

Suggestion.title: Suggestion

fields.value: Honed Mind, Master Focus or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

Suggestion.description: You smoothly plant a thought into the subject's head that lasts as long as this Feature is Bound. They won't know exactly why or how they thought of it; they will naturally assume they thought of it themselves, and their brain will attempt to get there as logically as it can. The target may not necessarily act on the Suggestion, especially if it is against their nature. Using Suggestion to plant a specific thought may cause the target to think about a specific subject, dredging up surface thoughts related to the matter. Using this on a target leaves discoverable psychic residue. You may only use Suggestion as long as you have the Telepathy Capability, though you may keep it Bound without having Telepathy active.

Style is Eternal.title: Style is Eternal

fields.value: Your Pokémon is Disarmed or would have their Held Item removed by another effect such as Thief or Covet
fields.name: Trigger

Style is Eternal.description: Your Pokémon instead retains their Held Item. Style is Eternal may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Style Flourish.title: Style Flourish

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Move of your Chosen Type
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value: The target gains +1 CS in the Stat corresponding to your chosen Contest Type, after the Move and all effects have been resolved.  is may only affect a target once per Scene.
fields.name: In Battle

Style Flourish.description: In Contests: Re-Roll all dice that result in 1s. This effect may only be used once per Contest.

Style Expert.title: Style Expert

fields.value: 3 Pokémon with 3d6 in a specific certain Contest Stat from Poffins OR Coordinator, 1 Pokémon with 3d6 in a specific certain Contest Stat from Poffins
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: When you take Style Expert, choose from Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough. This becomes your Chosen Contest Stat. You may take Style Expert multiple times, each time choosing a different Contest Stat.
fields.name: Note

Style Expert.description: Your Pokémon gain +2d6 to your chosen Contest Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.

Style Entrainment.title: Style Entrainment
Style Entrainment.description:
Your Pokémon gains one of the following Abilities corresponding to your chosen Contest Stat for the rest of the Scene, even if it is switched out. Style Entrainment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.
» Beauty gives Gentle Vibe or Serene Grace
» Cool gives Defiant or Sniper
» Cute gives Cute Charm or Cute Tears
» Smart gives Analytic or Anticipation
» Tough gives Sturdy or Intimidate

Strike of the Whip.title: Strike of the Whip
Strike of the Whip.description:
You may apply 1 or more of the following effects to the Pokémon hit by Press:
» Give the target 1 Injury and a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.
» Spend 1 AP and cure the target of Confusion, Infatuation, Rage, and Suppression.
» Use an [Order] you know with targets on the target as a Free Action.

Strike Again!.title: Strike Again!
Strike Again!.description: The target may immediately take an additional Standard Action to use an At-Will attack.

Street Fighter.title: Street Fighter

fields.value: Unexpected Attacks, two Rogue Skills at Expert Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Street Fighter.description: You learn the Moves Assurance and Payback.

Strange Energy.title: Strange Energy
Strange Energy.description: You learn the Moves Heal Block and Magic Coat.

Storm Wizard.title: Storm Wizard
Storm Wizard.description: You may learn two Moves from the list below, marked with the Storm Wizard Rank you are gaining or lower.

Stone Warrior.title: Stone Warrior

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Rock), Novice Combat, Novice Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Stone Warrior.description: You learn the Moves Rock Tomb and Wide Guard.

Stone Stance Mastery.title: Stone Stance Mastery

fields.value: Stone Stance, Master Combat or Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Stone Stance Mastery.description: Whenever you bind Stone Stance, you may choose two Stances and apply the effects of both.

Stone Stance.title: Stone Stance
Stone Stance.description:
You adopt one of the stances below, gaining the effects of the stance while this Feature remains bound. You may switch your active Stance as a Standard Action without rebinding your AP. The benefits from this Feature do not apply if you are not standing on a solid surface, such as deep mud or snow, or if you are outright swimming or even flying.
»Falling Boulder Stance
»Moon Mountain Stance
»Roiling Earth Stance

Stone Cold Finish.title: Stone Cold Finish

fields.value: Shards of Stone, Master Combat or Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Stone Cold Finish.description: You learn the Moves Stone Edge and Head Smash.

Steelheart.title: Steelheart

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Steel), Novice Athletics, Novice Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Steelheart.description: When wielding metal Melee Weapons, you may use Athletics or Focus instead of Combat to determine the Damage Base of your Struggle Attacks, to qualify for a Weapon's Moves, and to resist Disarm Checks. Whenever your Weapon Attacks hit a foe who has previously hit you with a Melee attack in the same round, the foe loses a Tick of Hit Points.

Steel Wind.title: Steel Wind
Steel Wind.description: You learn the Moves Bullet Punch and Metal Claw. You may use these Moves as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.

Staying Power.title: Staying Power
Staying Power.description: Your Pokémon may "Take a Breather" even if it is Confused or Enraged, and it does not Trip or have to Shift away from enemies as part of the action. You may choose whether or not your Pokémon resets their Combat Stages to default.

Stay With Us!.title: Stay With Us!

fields.value: Front Line Healer, Master Medicine Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: An Ally is hit by an attack
fields.name: Trigger

Stay With Us!.description: You must be able to Shift to your target to use this Feature. If you can, you immediately do so, and may apply a Potion, Super Potion, Hyper Potion, Energy Powder, or Energy Root. Though damage, injuries, and all other effects of the triggering attack are finalized before this Feature is applied, do not determine if the target has been Fainted, Killed, or gained Injuries from Hit Point Markers until after the effects of the action chosen through use of this Feature has been resolved.

Stat Training.title: Stat Training

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point
fields.name: Target

fields.value:
» Attack: Swords Dance or Rage
» Defense: Iron Defense or Reflect
» Special Attack: Nasty Plot or Hidden Power
» Special Defense: Amnesia or Light Screen
» Speed: Agility or After You
fields.name: Moves

Stat Training.description: Your Pokémon loses 1 Tutor Point, and learns a Move based on your Chosen Stat, even if your Pokémon cannot normally learn this Move.

Stat Stratagem.title: Stat Stratagem

fields.value: Stat Link, Stat Training, Master Focus or Command
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: The target’s damaging Melee Attacks have their Critical Hit Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Attack, up to a maximum of +3.
fields.name: Attack Effect

fields.value: The target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Paralysis, Sleep, and Freeze for each positive Combat Stage they have in Defense, up to a maximum of +6.
fields.name: Defense Effect

fields.value: The target’s damaging Ranged Attacks have their Effect Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Attack, up to a maximum of +3.
fields.name: Special Attack Effect

fields.value: The target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Confusion, Rage, and Infatuation for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Defense, up to a maximum of +6.
fields.name: Special Defense Effect

fields.value: The target’s Movement Capabilities are increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Speed, up to a maximum of +3.
fields.name: Speed Effect

Stat Stratagem.description: While this Feature is Bound, the target has the following bonuses based on your Chosen Stat:

Stat Mastery.title: Stat Mastery

fields.value: When your Pokémon successfully uses a Push, Disarm, or Dirty Trick Combat Maneuver, the target of the Maneuver loses a Tick of Hit Points.
fields.name: Attack Effect

fields.value: Whenever your Pokémon do not spend their Shift Action to Shift during a turn, they gain +5 Damage Reduction for one full round.
fields.name: Defense Effect

fields.value: The Range of your Pokémon’s Special Non-Melee Moves is increased by +2.  is does not affect the size of Area-Of-Effect moves (But does affect the range at which you can place Ranged Blasts).
fields.name: Special Attack Effect

fields.value: Whenever your Pokémon would lose a Tick of Hit Points from Status Aflictions, Weather, or other effects, they lose 5 fewer Hit Points, to a minimum of 1.
fields.name: Special Defense Effect

fields.value: Your Pokémon may take Disengage Maneuvers as Swift Actions.
fields.name: Speed Effect

Stat Mastery.description: Stat Mastery’s Effect depends on your Chosen Stat:

Stat Maneuver.title: Stat Maneuver

fields.value: Stat Ace, Adept Command or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You may activate this Feature to cause one of your Pokémon to use a Physical “Melee, 1-Target” Move as if its range was “Melee, Pass” or “Melee, 3-Targets” instead.
fields.name: Attack Effect

fields.value: You may activate this feature whenever your Pokémon is hit by a Physical Attack to receive the blow as if your Pokémon’s Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value.
fields.name: Defense Effect

fields.value: You may activate this Feature to allow your Pokémon to use a Special Burst, Cone, Close Blast, Ranged Blast, or Line of any size as a Burst 1, Cone 2, Close Blast 2, or Line 4 instead.
fields.name: Special Attack Effect

fields.value: You may activate this feature whenever your Pokémon is hit by a Special Attack to receive the blow as if your Pokémon’s Special Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value.
fields.name: Special Defense Effect

fields.value: You may activate this Feature at any time to cause your Pokémon to use a Move as Priority or a Priority Move as Priority (Advanced).
fields.name: Speed Effect

Stat Maneuver.description: Stat Maneuver’s Effect depends on your Chosen Stat:

Stat Link.title: Stat Link

fields.value: At the end of your Pokémon's turn, their Speed Stat is at its default number of Combat Stages or less.
fields.name: Trigger

Stat Link.description: The triggering Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage to your Chosen Stat. (Note: The "Default" number of Combat Stages is usually 0)

Stat Embodiment.title: Stat Embodiment

fields.value: 4 Stat Ace Features, Expert Command or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Stat Embodiment.description:
Your Pokémon gains an Ability, based on your Chosen Stat, for the remainder of the Scene. Switching does not end this effect. Stat Embodiment may only grant one Ability to a Pokémon at a time. If it is used a second time on the same target, it replaces the first granted Ability.
» Attack Aces give Sheer Force or Defiant
» Defense Aces give Filter or Battle Armor
» Special Attack Aces give Tinted Lens or Competitive
» Special Defense Aces give Multiscale or Tolerance
» Speed Aces give Speed Boost or Vanguard

Stat Ace.title: Stat Ace

fields.value: Ace Trainer or Style Expert, 1 Pokémon with the chosen stat of 15 or more, Novice Command or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Stat Ace.description: Your Pokémon have their Chosen Base Stat increased by +1, and by +1 more for every 10 Levels they have (for example, a Level 20 Pokémon would have your Chosen Stat's base value increased by +3). Additionally, your Pokémon may ignore Base Relations, as long as they are adding to your Chosen Stat, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated Stat Value.

Stalwart Bastion.title: Stalwart Bastion
Stalwart Bastion.description: While this Feature is Bound, you and all cardinally adjacent allies gain Damage Reduction equal to your Combat or Focus Rank.

Stacked Deck.title: Stacked Deck

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits a foe suffering from a Status Affliction or one of the other conditions in the table below
fields.name: Trigger

Stacked Deck.description: Choose a Status Affliction or condition the triggering target is suffering from; the target suffers an additional effect according to the table below. Stacked Deck may only affect a foe once per Scene.

Spirit Boost.title: Spirit Boost

fields.value: The target gains Bonus Damage when using Physical attacks equal to your Intuition Rank.
fields.name: Attack

fields.value: The target gains Damage Reduction against Physical attacks equal to your Intuition Rank.
fields.name: Defense

fields.value: The target gains gain Bonus Damage when using Special attacks equal to your Intuition Rank.
fields.name: Special Attack

fields.value: The target gains Damage Reduc- tion against Special attacks equal to your Intuition Rank.
fields.name: Special Defense

fields.value: The target gains a bonus to their Initiative equal to your Intuition Rank.
fields.name: Speed

Spirit Boost.description: When you use Spirit Boost, choose a Channeled Pokémon. You may choose the target of Spirit Boost if you wish. While Spirit Boost is Bound, the target has one of the following effects, depending on the highest Combat Stat of the chosen Pokémon. (In the event of a tie, you choose which Stat to use)

Species Savant.title: Species Savant

fields.value: 3 different individual Pokémon of the same evolutionary line
fields.name: Prerequisites

Species Savant.description: When you take Species Savant, choose a single Evolutionary Family. Your Pokémon of your Chosen Evolutionary Family have each of their Base Stats increased by +1.

Sparkle.title: Sparkle

fields.value: Prism, Expert Charm or General Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Sparkle.description: You learn the Moves Tri-Attack and Weather Ball.

Spark Master.title: Spark Master

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Electric), Novice Focus, Novice Acrobatics
fields.name: Prerequisites

Spark Master.description: Choose Static or Electrodash. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Space Distortion.title: Space Distortion
Space Distortion.description: You learn the Moves Teleport and Ally Switch.

Sovereignty.title: Sovereignty

fields.value: Herald of Pride, Expert Command or Intimidate
fields.name: Prerequisites

Sovereignty.description: While this Feature is bound, you gain a +2 Bonus to Save Checks against Volatile Status Afflictions, and a +2 Bonus to Opposed Checks when defending against being Disarmed, Grappled, Pushed, or Tripped.

Soul Investment.title: Soul Investment
Soul Investment.description: Choose one Novice and one Expert Arcane Weapon Move. Your Soul Bonded Weapon adds those Moves to your Move List as long as this Feature is Bound. You may only Bind one instance of this Feature at a time, and you may not have multiple instances of the same Move in your Move List.

Soothing Connection.title: Soothing Connection
Soothing Connection.description: Distribute 5 points in any way among Pokémon you are Channeling. For each point you assign to a Channeled Pokémon, they gain a Tick of Hit Points.

Sneak Attack.title: Sneak Attack

fields.value: Clever Ruse, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Sneak Attack.description: While this Feature is bound, when attacking foes that are Fainted, Flanked, Flinched, Sleeping, Stuck, Tripped, unaware of your Pokémon's presence, or otherwise do not expect an attack, the target gains a +2 bonus to Accuracy Rolls and a bonus to Damage Rolls equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

fields.value: You may create Simple Weapons for $1000, Light Shields for $1,500, and Light Armor for $4,000.
fields.name: Rank 1 Effect

fields.value: You may create Fine Weapons for $2,000, Helmets for $1,125, Heavy Shields for $2,250 and Heavy Armor for $5,000.
fields.name: Rank 2 Effect

Smashing Punishment.title: Smashing Punishment

fields.value: Close Quarters Mastery, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A Marked Foe provokes an Attack of Opportunity from your Fighting-Type Pokémon
fields.name: Trigger

Smashing Punishment.description: The Attack of Opportunity automatically hits, deals Fighting-Type Damage, and is a Critical Hit.

Smart Scheme.title: Smart Scheme
Smart Scheme.description: Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Smart Stat from Poffins may activate Smart Scheme as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Small Prophecies.title: Small Prophecies
Small Prophecies.description: Roll 1d20 and note the result. Until the end of your next turn, you may choose to replace a single d20 roll you or a willing ally makes with the noted result.

Slow or Steady.title: Slow or Steady
Slow or Steady.description: Choose Analytic or Battle Armor. You gain the chosen ability.

Sleight.title: Sleight
Sleight.description: Your Pokémon may activate Sleight as an Interrupt to immediately take their turn and use a Status- Class Move as a Standard Action. If this Move targets a foe, it ignores Substitute and Defensive Abilities, and Blessings may not be activated against the Move.

Skirmisher.title: Skirmisher
Skirmisher.description: Choose Flutter or Vanguard. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Skill Trainer.title: Skill Trainer
Skill Trainer.description: For each of your Pokémon that has been Trained during this time, choose a Skill; that Skill becomes Pushed until an Extended Rest is taken. Pokémon rolls +1d6 with Pushed Skills, unless that would cause you to roll more than 6d6; if so, that Pokémon rolls with a +3 Bonus instead. A Pokémon may have only one Pushed Skill at a time.

Skill Monkey.title: Skill Monkey

fields.value: Three Skills at Adept Rank or higher
fields.name: Prerequisites

Skill Monkey.description: You may re-roll the triggering Skill Check with a +2 Bonus, taking the new result. This Feature may be used to re-roll a specific roll only once.

Simple Improvements.title: Simple Improvements

fields.value: Extra Ordinary, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

Simple Improvements.description: Add your Type-Linked Skill Rank to all of your Pokémon's rolls this turn. Your Pokémon gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Type-Linked Skill Rank. Simple Improvements may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Silent Assassin.title: Silent Assassin

fields.value: Apparition, Adept Intimidate or Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Silent Assassin.description: While this Feature is Bound, your Struggle Attacks and Weapon Attacks deal Ghost-Type Damage, and you gain the Dead Silent Capability.

Signer.title: Signer
Signer.description: Choose a Rank 1 Blessing. You gain this Blessing in the form of a Sign. Signs store the energy of the Divine, and may be activated as a Swift Action. Signs can be used once per Scene, and cost 1 AP to activate.

Signature Technique.title: Signature Technique

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
fields.name: Target

Signature Technique.description:
The target loses 2 Tutor Points. Choose one Move on the Target’s Move List. That Move becomes the target’s Signature Technique, and you may apply one of the modifications listed below to the Move. The Move being modified must fit the category of the modification, and you must have the associated Training Feature to apply a modification. A Pokémon may only have one Signature Technique at a time. If you choose to teach a Pokémon a different Signature Technique, the old one is lost, and 1 Tutor Point is refunded. 1 Tutor Point is also refunded if the Pokémon ever forgets a Signature Technique Move.

See ```Signature Technique List``` for more details.

Signature Move.title: Signature Move
Signature Move.description: Choose a Move you know. Increase the Move's Frequency one step, as if you had used a PP Up. This choice cannot be changed once made. This Feature may not select Moves known through temporary means, nor can these Moves be used to qualify for this Feature.

fields.value: Select a Rank 1 Power Manipulation. This Manipulation maybe used twice per Scene without spending AP to activate.
fields.name: Rank 1 Effect

fields.value: Select a Rank 1 Power Manipulation. This Manipulation maybe used twice per Scene without spending AP to activate. OR Select a Rank 2 power Manipulation. This Manipulation may be used once per Scene without activating Authentic Thaumaturgy's Frequency.
fields.name: Rank 2 Effect

Sign Mastery.title: Sign Mastery

fields.value: All your Patron’s Major Gifts, GM Permission
fields.name: Rank 3 Prerequisites

fields.value: If your Patron does not have a Pact Gift, you instead require all their Major Gifts to attain Rank 4.
fields.name: Note

Sign Mastery.description: You acquire two Blessings in the form of Signs, marked with the Sign Mastery Rank you are gaining or lower. You must additionally meet any Prerequisites of the Blessing.

Shrug Off.title: Shrug Off
Shrug Off.description: Once per day, each of your Pokémon may spend a Shift Action to remove 1 Injury from themselves; this may also be activated as a Free Action whenever your Pokémon Take a Breather.

Shocking Speed.title: Shocking Speed
Shocking Speed.description: You may activate this Feature to have your Electric-Type Pokémon may use an Electric-Type Move with a Frequency of At-Will as if it had Priority (Advanced).

Shield Bearer.title: Shield Bearer
Shield Bearer.description: You may immediately ready a Shield, and do not become Slowed as a result. You may choose to grant an adjacent Ally the Evasion and Damage Reduction bonuses from your shield instead of gaining them yourself, but these bonuses only apply as long as the ally remains adjacent to you. If you do and the ally Shifts, you may Shift alongside your ally as a Shift Action Interrupt. This cannot cause you to shift more than your normal Movement.

Sharpen Shadows.title: Sharpen Shadows

fields.value: Shade Caller, Expert Guile or Stealth
fields.name: Prerequisites

Sharpen Shadows.description: You learn Dark Pulse and Night Slash

fields.value: You gain access to your Legendary Form’s Abilities while in your Avatar form.
fields.name: Rank 1 Effect

fields.value: You gain your Legendary Form’s Types while in your Avatar Form
fields.name: Rank 2 Effect

fields.value: You gain access to your Legendary Form’s Move List while in your Avatar Form.
fields.name: Rank 3 Effect

fields.value: Your Legendary Form, by default, has access to all Capabilities, Abilities and Moves your Avatar does.
fields.name: Note

Shared Senses.title: Shared Senses
Shared Senses.description: You Imprint the target for the duration of this Feature. You receive all sensory information being sensed by Imprinted Pokémon, and Imprinted Pokémon are not subject to the distance limit on Channeling. If you have Imprinted more than one Pokémon, you may only concentrate on the senses of one Pokémon at a time, and only choose one such Pokémon per round. If you stop Channeling a Pokémon, they are no longer Imprinted as well.

Shards of Stone.title: Shards of Stone

fields.value: Stone Warrior, Expert Combat or Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Shards of Stone.description: You learn the Moves Rock Slide and Stealth Rock

Shadow Form.title: Shadow Form

fields.value: Silent Assassin, Expert Intimidate or Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Shadow Form.description: While this Feature is Bound, your appearance becomes wan and obviously otherworldly. Your natural Weaknesses, Resistances, and Immunities change to match that of the Ghost Type. Additionally, while in Shadow Form, you are immune to the Cursed Status (if you were previously Cursed, you are instantly cured upon going into Shadow Form) and gain the Phasing Capability. You may unbind this Feature as a Swift Action, returning to your normal appearance.

Shadow Arms.title: Shadow Arms
Shadow Arms.description: You learn the Moves Shadow Punch and Shad- ow Sneak. You may use these as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.

Shade Caller.title: Shade Caller

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Dark), Novice Guile, Novice Stealth
fields.name: Prerequisites

Shade Caller.description: You learn the Moves Faint Attack and Snarl.

Sentry Runes.title: Sentry Runes

fields.value: Expert Occult Education, Explosive Runes, Hidden Power
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A Glyph you have put down, regardless of distance
fields.name: Target

Sentry Runes.description: The target Glyph becomes an Unown of your Trainer Level, its Stats allocated as you wish. This Unown knows a single instance of Hidden Power, identical to your own. The Glyph can fight on its own without needing you to command it. At the end of the encounter, or after 5 minutes, the Unown returns to Unown Space forever, destroying the Glyph. You may only have one Glyph active in this way at a time; if various Alarm Glyphs are triggered to become Sentries at the same time, only one does so; the others will do so once the previous one has been destroyed if the Trigger condition is still being met.

Sentinel Stance.title: Sentinel Stance
Sentinel Stance.description: Until the end of your next turn, the target may attempt to Intercept attacks for allies as a Shift Action. If they do so, they gain 10 Damage Reduction against the attack. If the target is also under the effect of Brace for Impact, they may gain 5 Damage Reduction from it as if they had used a self-targeting Status Move.

Seize The Moment.title: Seize The Moment

fields.value: Your Pokémon would gain Momentum while already at 6 Momentum
fields.name: Trigger

Seize The Moment.description: Your Pokémon loses 6 Momentum, and then gains +1 Momentum. Your Pokémon may immediately make an attack as an Interrupt, but this attack must target only a Tagged Foe. If the attack misses, it still deals damage as if it had the Smite keyword. If the attack hits, it's automatically a Critical Hit. If it would have already been a Critical Hit, your Pokémon gains Hit Points equal to half of its maximum Hit Points. May be used only once per Scene per Pokémon .

fields.value: Botany Research Field, Green Thumb, Adept General Education or Adept Survival
fields.name: Rank 1 Prerequisites

fields.value: Master General Education or Master Survival
fields.name: Rank 2 Prerequisites

fields.value: You become adept at harvesting Seeds and Spores from Pokémon. You may target a willing Grass-Type Pokémon that knows Sleep Powder, Stun Spore, or Poison Powder. Add this move to your Move list for the remainder of the day. You may not use Seed Bag to have multiple instances of the same move in your Move list. Seed Bag may be used twice per day per Rank.
fields.name: Rank 1 Effect

fields.value: You may also harvest Cotton Spore, Leech Seed, Spore, or Worry Seed.
fields.name: Rank 2 Effect

Second Strike.title: Second Strike

fields.value: You attempt to use a Grapple, Push, Trip, or Disarm Combat Maneuver but fail the Opposed Roll
fields.name: Trigger

Second Strike.description: You may immediately use Rock Smash or a Struggle Attack against your target as a Free Action.

Scoundrel's Strike.title: Scoundrel's Strike

fields.value: You hit with a Rogue Move
fields.name: Trigger

Scoundrel's Strike.description:
The target loses Hit Points equal to your highest Rogue Skill Rank doubled, and an additional effect based on whether you have the Ambush or Cruelty Ability. You may use Scoundrel's Strike only once per Scene per target.
» Ambush
» Cruelty

Scheme Twist.title: Scheme Twist

fields.value: You give [Orders] with a Daily or Scene Frequency that have Targets.
fields.name: Trigger

Scheme Twist.description: You may target up to two additional Allies with the [Orders].

Savage Strike.title: Savage Strike

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
fields.name: Target

Savage Strike.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and gains the Cruelty Ability.

Sage's Benediction.title: Sage's Benediction

fields.value: Sacred Shield or Mystic Defense, Adept Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: An ally activates one of your Moves with the Blessing Keyword.
fields.name: Target

Sage's Benediction.description:
The triggering ally gains an additional benefit as follows, depending on the Move used. The benefit takes effect after the Blessing and the attack that triggered it are resolved.
» Reflect
» Light Screen
» Safeguard
» Lucky Chant

Sage.title: Sage
Sage.description: The target gains Damage Reduction equal to your Occult Education Rank doubled or their Tick Value, whichever is higher, for one full round. Multiple uses of Sage from different Trainers do not stack on one target.

Sacred Shield.title: Sacred Shield
Sacred Shield.description: You learn the Moves Reflect and Lucky Chant.

Rune Master.title: Rune Master
Rune Master.description: You gain the Gather Unown capability, and your Unown gain the Letter Press Capability. When using Gather Unown, you are treated as a level 20 Pokémon.

Rule of Cool.title: Rule of Cool

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Cool-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value: The triggering Move's Crit Range is increased by 3, and the Moves with the Interrupt Keyword may not be activated in reaction to this Move. You may activate Rule of Cool only once per Pokémon per Scene.
fields.name: In Battles

Rule of Cool.description: In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.

Rouse the Dragon's Blood.title: Rouse the Dragon's Blood

fields.value: Herald of Pride, Expert Command or Intimidate
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You suffer a Critical Hit or gain an Injury from a foe's attack
fields.name: Trigger

Rouse the Dragon's Blood.description: For 1 full round, the next Herald of Pride Move you use against the triggering foe cannot miss, cannot be Intercepted, and effects that would cause it to miss cannot be activated against it.

Round Trip.title: Round Trip
Round Trip.description: You may immediately switch your Pokémon that just performed a Move for another of your Pokémon. This effect lets Pokémon with the Trapped condition switch out.

Roughneck.title: Roughneck

fields.value: You hit a foe with an Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Roughneck.description: The foe loses a Combat Stage in the Stat of your choice.

Rogue.title: Rogue

fields.value: Two of Acrobatics, Athletics, and Stealth at Novice Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Rogue.description: You learn the Moves Feint Attack and Thief.

Rock Power.title: Rock Power

fields.value: Stone Warrior, Adept Combat or Survival
fields.name: Rank 1 Prerequisites

Rock Power.description: Each Rank, choose one of Sturdy, Rock Head, Run Up, or Sand Veil. You gain the chosen Ability. If you choose Sand Veil, you may consider sand a "solid surface" for the purposes of Stone Stance.

Robofighter.title: Robofighter
Robofighter.description: As long as this feature is Bound, you can command your Pokébot using a Standard Action rather than a Pokémon turn. Your Pokébots may still only act once a round.

Rider.title: Rider

fields.value: Mounted Prowess, Agility Training, Novice Acrobatics or Athletics
fields.name: Prerequisites

Rider.description: While you are Mounted on a Pokemon under the effects of Agility Training, the bonuses from Agility Training are doubled.

Ride as One.title: Ride as One
Ride as One.description: While you are Mounted, you and your Mount each use the highest of each other's Speed Evasion. If both you and your Mount have the same Speed Evasion, you instead each receive a +1 bonus to Speed Evasion. Whenever one of you receives Initiative, either of you may take your turn. When the next person would receive initiative, the person that did not take their turn then takes it.

Rewrite.title: Rewrite

fields.value: Self or a willing Pokémon with Hidden Power.
fields.name: Target

Rewrite.description: Reroll the Type for an instance of Hidden Pow- er the target knows If you target an Unown, you may transform the target into a different letter.

Resilience.title: Resilience

fields.value: Your Pokémon is hit by a Critical Hit or gains a Status Affliction (or both)
fields.name: Trigger

Resilience.description: Your Pokémon does not gain a Status Affliction, and the triggering attack does damage as if it was not a Critical Hit. Resilience may only be used once per target per Scene.

Researcher.title: Researcher

fields.value: An Education Skill at Novice Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Researcher.description: Choose two Researcher Fields of Study. You may take Features from those Fields with this instance of Researcher. Gain one Feature from a chosen Researcher Field for which you qualify.

Reliable Performance.title: Reliable Performance

fields.value: Nuanced Performance, Master Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon makes an Appeal Roll, Accuracy Check, or Skill Check
fields.name: Trigger

Reliable Performance.description: For appeal rolls, instead of making the Appeal Roll, you gain 1 Appeal Point for each Dice you would have rolled. For Accuracy Checks, act as if you had rolled a 10. For Skill Checks, multiply 3.5 by your Pokémon's Skill Rank, and use the resulting number as the result of your roll, rounded down. For all rolls, add or subtract any modifiers as normal.

Recoup Energy.title: Recoup Energy

fields.value: Your Special Move misses all targets
fields.name: Trigger

Recoup Energy.description: You do not expend the Frequency of the trig- gering Move. If you applied a Power Manipulation to the triggering Move, you are refunded the AP for the Manipulation or do not expend the Frequency for it.

Reckless Advance.title: Reckless Advance
Reckless Advance.description: While this Feature is Bound, increase the damage rolls of the target’s damaging melee attacks by +8, and these attacks Trip targets on Accuracy Rolls of 18+. When the target of Reckless Advance hits with a damaging melee attack, they become Vulnerable for one full round.

Reality Bender.title: Reality Bender
Reality Bender.description: You are able to subconsciously alter the fabric of reality to change small facts or circumstances. If your character is confronting a "random" event such as a die roll, coin flip, or cards being dealt, the character may activate this Feature to influence the event. In this scenario, the GM provides you with two possible outcomes, and you pick one of them to actually occur. This means you always decide the outcome of binary events such as a coin flip; cheating cards or slot machines is much harder, as there are multiple outcomes and you only get to pick between two. This Feature can also be used to generate common items worth $250 or less that the character might normally possess, such as a Potion or Poké Ball, when in a pinch. The character just happens to find the needed item among their belongings. This Feature can only create items you wish to use at that moment, and of which you have none available; such as needing to heal a Pokémon but having no Potions left. Items created with Reality Bender must be used quickly after activating the feature and cannot be stored for later.

Reactive Armour.title: Reactive Armour

fields.value: You gain an Injury or take a Critical Hit while wearing metallic Armor
fields.name: Trigger

Reactive Armour.description: All foes within a Burst 1 lose Hit Points equal to double your Athletics or Focus Rank, and you gain Damage Reduction equal to double your Athletics or Focus Rank for one full round.

Re-Balancing.title: Re-Balancing
Re-Balancing.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and gains one of the following: +1 to all Base Stats, +2 to two different Base Stats, or +3 to a single Base Stat. The target then redistributes their Stat Points. A Pokémon may be targeted by Re-Balancing only once.

Ravager Orders.title: Ravager Orders
Ravager Orders.description: You gain the Reckless Advance and Strike Again! Orders.

Ramming Speed.title: Ramming Speed

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
fields.name: Target

fields.value: Run Up is no longer available as a normal Ability, but this feature still grants the effect as an Ability. As such, it is not available for normal lookup, but is presented here instead.
fields.name: Note

fields.value:
Static
If the user moves in a straight line to a target and uses a damaging Melee Attack, it may add the number of meters traveled in a direct line as Bonus Damage to a Damage Roll.
Core: p.328
fields.name: Run Up

Ramming Speed.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and gains the Run Up Ability.

Rainbow Surge.title: Rainbow Surge

fields.value: Sparkle, Master Charm or General Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Rainbow Surge.description: You learn the Moves Hyper Beam and Morning Sun.

Rainbow Light.title: Rainbow Light

fields.value: You are wearing a Rainbow Gem
fields.name: Trigger

Rainbow Light.description: You create a Rainbow lasting one full round. While this Rainbow persists, the Effect Range of all Allies is increased by +3.

Raging Winds.title: Raging Winds
Raging Winds.description: You may learn two Moves from the list below, marked with the Raging Winds Rank you are gaining or lower.

Quick Wit.title: Quick Wit

fields.value: Provocateur, a Provocateur Skill at Adept Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Quick Wit.description: You may make a Manipulate Maneuver or use a Social Move you know, Frequency allowing.

Quick Switch.title: Quick Switch

fields.value: Your Pokémon Faints; or an opponent sends out a Pokémon
fields.name: Trigger

Quick Switch.description: You may return and send out a Pokémon as a Free Action. You may perform this Feature on your turn without a Trigger. Pokémon sent out by Quick Switch cannot trigger another Trainer's Quick Switch. When you swap Pokémon using Quick Switch, you do not lose a Pokémon turn.

Quick Healing.title: Quick Healing
Quick Healing.description: Your Hardened Pokémon may use Quick Healing to remove up to three injuries, and gains two Ticks of Hit Points for each Injury removed this way.

Quick Gymnastics.title: Quick Gymnastics

fields.value: You hit with an Attack; you make a Jump; or you stand up from being Tripped
fields.name: Trigger

Quick Gymnastics.description: You may may Shift 2 Meters. You don't count as Flanked or trigger Attacks of Opportunity until the end of your next turn. Additionally, if you activate this Feature, the triggering action does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity.

Pusher.title: Pusher

fields.value: Pokémon Caretaking Research Field, Novice Pokémon Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pusher.description: Your Pokémon gain the Basic Ranged Attacks, Aura Pulse, Enticing Bait, Extended Invisibility, Far Reading, Precise Threadings, Seismometer, TK Mastery, and Trail Sniffer Poke Edges automatically if they qualify for them, without having to invest any Tutor Points.

Push it to the Limit.title: Push it to the Limit

fields.value: Lessons in Rage and Pain, Expert Intimidate
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit with a Berserker Move or Weapon Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Push it to the Limit.description: Immediately gain one Injury before resolving the triggering attack. You gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points and may cure yourself of a Persistent Status Af- fliction. The triggering attack doubles your damage bo- nus from Lessons in Rage and Pain.

Push Buttons.title: Push Buttons
Push Buttons.description: Your Social Moves' Frequency is not Expended if they miss. You gain the Demoralize Edge, even if you do not meet the prerequisites. Its effects for Status Moves now trigger on 18+, and Social Moves that activate this "Crit" Range cause their targets to lose a tick of Hit Points. If you already have Demoralize, you may gain another Edge for which you meet the prerequisites.

Psychic Resonance.title: Psychic Resonance

fields.value: Psionic Sponge, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Psychic-Type Status Move
fields.name: Trigger

Psychic Resonance.description: Your Pokémon may use the Move Encore against the triggering foe, as if it was on their Move List.

Psionic Sponge.title: Psionic Sponge
Psionic Sponge.description: Your Psychic-Type Pokémon may activate Psychic Sponge as a Shift Action to add a Psychic Type Move known by an ally within X meters to their Move List until the end of their turn. This does not allow them to have duplicate Moves in their Move List. This Feature may only be used once per Pokémon per Scene, and X is equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Psionic Sight.title: Psionic Sight
Psionic Sight.description: You are able to visibly see any Psychic Residue left on Humans or Pokémon due to the effects of Psionic abilities. Each Human or Pokémon leaves distinct Psychic Residue on their targets; you are easily able to distinguish which targets have been affected by the same Psionic, though to identify that Psionic you need to have a way of knowing their signature (such as simply seeing them do it, and seeing the resulting signature).

Psionic Overload.title: Psionic Overload

fields.value: You hit with Psychic or use another Telekinetic Move
fields.name: Trigger

Psionic Overload.description:
The effect of this Feature depends on the Triggering Move.
» Kinesis
» Barrier
» Psychic
» Telekinesis

Psionic Analysis.title: Psionic Analysis
Psionic Analysis.description:
You are able to analyze Psychic Residue and can determine the following information about the Trainer or Pokémon that left the residue:
» Whether they are a Human or a Pokémon
» Which Psychic-Type Moves they know
» If they're Human, which of the following Class Features they have

Provocateur.title: Provocateur

fields.value: One of Con dence Artist, Intimidating Presence, or Charmer
fields.name: Prerequisites

Provocateur.description: You learn the Moves Sweet Kiss and Taunt.

Proper Care.title: Proper Care

fields.value: I'm a Doctor, Field Clinic, Expert Medicine Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Proper Care.description:
You gain additional bonuses to using Restoratives and Features while in a Field Clinic, Poke Center, Hospital, or other dedicated healing space that lets you access supplies.
» When you trigger First Aid Expertise here, the injury that is Removed does not count towards the total number of Injuries that may be removed each day.
» When you trigger Nurse here, Bandages cure 1 Injury after three hours, in addition the injury healed after 6 hours.
» All Restoratives heal an additional 5 Hit Points. This stacks with the bonus granted by Field Clinic.

Prismatic Alignment.title: Prismatic Alignment

fields.value: 4 Prism Features, Master Charm or General Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Prismatic Alignment.description:
The effect of this Feature depends on the Triggering Move. You may only use Prismatic Alignment with each Move once per Scene.
»Flash
»Swift
»Tri Attack
»Weather Ball
»Hyper Beam
»Morning Sun

Prism.title: Prism

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Normal), Novice General Education, Novice Charm
fields.name: Prerequisites

Prism.description: You learn the Moves Flash and Swift.

Press On!.title: Press On!

fields.value: Pokémon cannot use the Moves Explosion, Endure, Pain Split, or Self-Destruct while they have 0 Hit Points or less. Pokémon with the Soulless capability cannot benefit from Press On!
fields.name: Note:

Press On!.description:
Your Hardened Pokemon gain the following benefits, based on your Intimidate Rank
» Expert:When your Pokemon Faints, you may pay 1 AP. If you do, your Pokemon Faints at -30% Hit Points instead.
» Master: While acting at 0 Hit Points or less, your Pokemon’s Critical Hit, Effect Range, Evasion, Initiative, Damage Reduction, and Resistance Bonuses from being Hardened are doubled.

Press.title: Press
Press.description: You hit your Pokémon, and they lose 1/6th of their Max Hit Points and are cured of Sleep. Raise any two of their Stats by +1 CS each, and you may add half of your Intimidate Rank to any Skill Checks made this round to make this Pokémon obey orders. Using Press on a Pokémon may make them dislike you.

fields.value: You are hit by an attack
fields.name: Trigger

Prehistoric Bond.title: Prehistoric Bond

fields.value: The remains of a Fossil you revived
fields.name: Target

Prehistoric Bond.description: You also produce a Held Item from the remnants of the Fossil. The effect of this Held Item is based on the highest Base Stat of the individual Pokémon being Revived, counting the effects of Nature but no other effects that alter Base Stats. If there is a tie, the GM decides which Base Stat is used. This Held Item may only be used by Pokémon revived from Fossils

Precision Orders.title: Precision Orders
Precision Orders.description: You gain the Pinpoint Strike and Perfect Aim Orders.

Powerful Motivator.title: Powerful Motivator

fields.value: Provocateur, two Provocateur Skills at Adept Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Powerful Motivator.description:
Baby-Doll Eyes, Confide, Leer, and your Provocateur Moves gain additional effects. These effects occur whether the Move hits or misses.
» Baby-Doll Eyes
» Confide
» Leer
» Sweet Kiss
» Taunt
» Torment
» Lovely Kiss

Power of the Mind.title: Power of the Mind
Power of the Mind.description: Choose Interference or Levitate. You gain the chosen Ability.

Power of Rage.title: Power of Rage
Power of Rage.description: Choose Enduring Rage, or White Flame. You gain the chosen Ability.

Power Pirouette.title: Power Pirouette

fields.value: Dance Form; Expert Acrobatics, Athletics, or Charm
fields.name: Prerequisites

Power Pirouette.description:
Choose one effect:
» All adjacent targets are Confused.
» You gain +1 Combat Stage to a Stat of your choice not raised by the triggering Move.
» Destroy all Hazards within 5 meters, and remove Leech Seed, Trapped, and Stuck from yourself.

Power Conduit.title: Power Conduit
Power Conduit.description:
Choose One:
» Trade all Combat Stages for a single Stat between two Channeled Pokémon
» Transfer a Coat from one Channeled Pokémon to another.
» Give up a use of Scene or Daily Move from one willing Channeled Pokémon to regain use of a Scene Move which another Channeled Pokémon has used. This effect may only refresh a Move for each Pokémon once per Scene.

Power Chord.title: Power Chord

fields.value: Noise Complaint, Master Charm or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Power Chord.description: Make a Charm or Focus Check, and add your Special Attack. Foes in the area of effect take Special Normal-Type Damage equal to the result.

Potent Venom.title: Potent Venom

fields.value: Your Poison-Type Pokémon inflicts Poison on a foe
fields.name: Trigger

Potent Venom.description: The foe does not necessarily lose Special Defense Combat Stages from Poison; instead, they lose Combat Stages in the Combat Stat of your choice. Whenever the target loses Hit Points from Poison, they lose additional Hit Points equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Polished Shine.title: Polished Shine
Polished Shine.description: The Effect Range of your Pokémon's Steel-Type Moves is increased by +2.

Polar Vortex.title: Polar Vortex

fields.value: Glacial Ice, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Polar Vortex.description: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Hail.

PokéManiac.title: PokéManiac
PokéManiac.description: Make a Pokemon Education Check with a DC of 10. If you succeed, you determine the target's Level, Types, Nature, and Abilities.

Poké Ball Mods.title: Poké Ball Mods
Poké Ball Mods.description: You may craft any of the Poké Ball Modifications on the next page.

Poké Ball Crafter.title: Poké Ball Crafter

fields.value: Basic Balls, Poké Ball Repair, Expert Technology
fields.name: Prerequisites

Poké Ball Crafter.description: You may craft Dusk, Dive, Heal, Luxury, Net, Nest, Quick, Repeat, or Timer Balls for $700. Requires access to a Poké Ball Tool Box.

Poison Weapons.title: Poison Weapons
Poison Weapons.description: The attack or Move Poisons its targets on 16+, and you may have it deal Poison-Type Damage if you wish.

Playing God.title: Playing God
Playing God.description:
Choose Castform, Grimer, Koffing, Magnemite, Porygon, Solosis, Trubbish, or Voltorb. Using your chemistry set, you create an artificial Egg of the Chosen Pokémon, that hatches within a day. The resulting Pokemon is born at level 5, with the Nature and Ability of your choice (Abilities chosen from its species' Basic Abilities). Additionally, you may enhance the Pokemon in several ways. Choose a number of upgrades below equal to your Technology Education Rank.
» The Pokémon is of an unusual coloration, gaining a +2d6 Bonus to the Introduction Stage of a Contest toward a single Contest Stat.
The Pokémon adds a Move from its Egg Move or Move Tutor List to its Inheritance List. This may be performed up to 3 times.
» Increase one of the Pokémon's Base Stats by +1. This counts as use of a Vitamin. This may be performed up to 5 times.

Play Them Like a Fiddle.title: Play Them Like a Fiddle

fields.value: Powerful Motivator, a Provocateur Skill at Expert Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit with Leer, Confide, Baby-Doll Eyes, or a Provocateur Move
fields.name: Trigger

Play Them Like a Fiddle.description:
The Move gains additional effects as listed below. You may use the effects of each Move only once per Scene.
» Baby-Doll Eyes
» Confide
» Leer
» Sweet Kiss
» Taunt
» Torment
» Lovely Kiss

Plains Runner.title: Plains Runner – Grassland Terrain
Plains Runner.description: Your Overland Speed is increased by +2. You gain a +2 bonus to Perception Checks to spot or identify objects in the far distance.

Plainly Perfect.title: Plainly Perfect

fields.value: Extra Ordinary, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Plainly Perfect.description: While this Feature is bound, instead of rolling for damage with Normal-Type Moves, your Pokémon acts as if they rolled the maximum value on their Damage Dice Roll. Plainly Perfect only works for the first instance of the Damage Dice Roll on Critical Hits.

Pinpoint Strike.title: Pinpoint Strike
Pinpoint Strike.description: Increase the Accuracy and Effect Range of the target’s damaging attacks by +2. These attacks deal 5 less damage, before applying weakness and resistance.

Pheromone Markers.title: Pheromone Markers

fields.value: You hit a foe with a damaging Bug-Type attack
fields.name: Trigger

Pheromone Markers.description: The triggering foe gains 1 Pheromone Stack. Your Bug-Type attacks gain a +2 bonus to Accuracy Rolls and +1 Critical Hit range against foes for each Pheromone Stack they have. Once per Scene per foe, when they gain their third or higher Pheromone Stack, you may choose to roll 1d6. On a result of 1 or 2, the foe becomes Con- fused; on a result of 3 or 4 the foe becomes Suppressed; on a result of 5 or 6 the foe becomes Enraged.

Phantom Menace.title: Phantom Menace

fields.value: Shadow Arms, Expert Intimidate or Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Phantom Menace.description: You gain the Moves Shadow Claw and Phantom Force. You may use these Moves as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.

Perseverance.title: Perseverance
Perseverance.description: The target instead does not gain an Injury. Perseverance may activate only once per Scene per target.

Perfect Aim.title: Perfect Aim
Perfect Aim.description: The next damaging attack the target performs before the end of your next turn automatically hits and ignores Defensive Abilities but deals damage as if it were resisted one step further than normal. You may still roll to trigger any Effect Ranges or Critical Hits. All targets of the attack may not activate any Blessings in response, and the attack may not be Intercepted or avoided in any way (ex: with Dodge, Shield Moves, etc).

Patch Cure.title: Patch Cure
Patch Cure.description: You distill the target, gaining 3 Restorative Patches. Restorative Patches have the same effect as the items from which they were created, but can only be applied as an Extended Action.

Passionato Harmony.title: Passionato Harmony

fields.value: Glamour Weaver, Expert Charm or Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites
