Passionato Harmony.description: You learn the Moves Dazzling Gleam and Draining Kiss.

Passing Waltz.title: Passing Waltz

fields.value: Dance Practice; Master Acrobatics, Athletics, or Charm
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You or one of your Pokémon with Own Tempo or Spinning Dance uses a Dance Move
fields.name: Trigger

Passing Waltz.description: Choose an ally within 3 meters of the triggering target. That ally gains Combat Stages from the triggering Move instead of the user.

Parfumier.title: Parfumier

fields.value: Fashionista, one Fashionista Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Parfumier.description: Whenever you create an Incense Held Item, choose Sweet Scent or Aromatic Mist. While your Pokémon is holding that Incense Item in an active Held Item slot, they add the chosen Move to their Move List.

Pain Resistance.title: Pain Resistance

fields.value: Your Pokémon with 1 or more injuries takes Damage
fields.name: Trigger

Pain Resistance.description: Your Pokémon gains X Damage Reduction against the triggering attack, where X is its Tick Value multiplied by the number of Injuries it has. This may be triggered once per Scene per Pokémon.

Pain Dampening.title: Pain Dampening

fields.value: A Channeled Pokémon would be Fainted by a damaging attack
fields.name: Target

Pain Dampening.description: Choose any number of Channeled Pokémon, which must include the triggering Pokémon. Instead of resolving the attack normally, divide the damage from the attack by the number of chosen Pokémon. Each chosen Pokémon then loses that many Hit Points. For each chosen Pokémon that Resists or is Immune to the Type of the triggering attack, subtract your Intuition Rank from the damage of the attack before all calculations.

Pact Gift - Water Spout.title: Pact Gift - Water Spout
Pact Gift - Water Spout.description: You learn the Move Water Spout.

Pact Gift - Spacial Rend.title: Pact Gift - Spacial Rend

fields.value: All Palkia and Shared Creation Trio Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Spacial Rend.description: You learn the Move Spacial Rend.

Pact Gift - Slayer of the False Gods.title: Pact Gift - Slayer of the False Gods

fields.value: Dispel one of the target’s Legendary Auras for the rest of the encounter.
fields.name: Effect

Pact Gift - Shadow Force.title: Pact Gift - Shadow Force

fields.value: All Giratina and Shared Creation Trio Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Shadow Force.description: You learn the Move Shadow Force.

Pact Gift - Sacred Fire.title: Pact Gift - Sacred Fire

fields.value: All Ho-Oh and Shared Tower Duo Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Sacred Fire.description: You learn the Move Sacred Fire.

Pact Gift - Roar of Time.title: Pact Gift - Roar of Time

fields.value: All Dialga and Shared Creation Trio Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Roar of Time.description: You learn the Move Roar of Time.

fields.value: Twin Souls, Expanded Horizons, Mental Suggestion
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Origin Tutor.title: Pact Gift - Origin Tutor

fields.value: Your Pokémon loses 3 Tutor Points and may make use of any TM or Tutoring effect to learn a single Move regardless of what it is normally capable of learning. It must still pay any Tutor Point costs for this effect. You may only target a Pokémon once with Origin Tutor.
fields.name: Effect

Pact Gift - Origin Tutor.description: Target: Your Pokémon with at least 3 Tutor Points

Pact Gift - Oblivion Wing.title: Pact Gift – Oblivion Wing

fields.value: All Yveltal Major Gifts and Shared Mortality Duo Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Oblivion Wing.description: You learn the Move Oblivion Wing.

Pact Gift - Magma Storm.title: Pact Gift - Magma Storm
Pact Gift - Magma Storm.description: You learn the Move Magma Storm.

Pact Gift - Lunar Dance.title: Pact Gift - Lunar Dance
Pact Gift - Lunar Dance.description: You learn the Move Lunar Dance.

Pact Gift - Land's Wrath.title: Pact Gift – Land’s Wrath
Pact Gift - Land's Wrath.description: You learn the Move Land’s Wrath.

Pact Gift - Hypergeometry.title: Pact Gift - Hypergeometry
Pact Gift - Hypergeometry.description:
Static Effect: You may always treat the distance between you and any other Trainer or Pokémon as one meter greater or one meter less as you choose for the purpose of calculating range or distance of travel. You may not use this to avoid melee attacks by switching between making their distance greater or less - a value is chosen when an action is announced and cannot be changed afterwards.

Scene Effect: You may activate this Pact Gift once per Scene when hit by a single target attack. The attack instead hits a target of your choice in an adjacent square to you.

Pact Gift - Hyper Beam.title: Pact Gift - Hyper Beam
Pact Gift - Hyper Beam.description: You learn the Move Hyper Beam.

fields.value: All Kyurem and Shared Tao Trio Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Ghost in the Machine.title: Pact Gift - Ghost in the Machine
Pact Gift - Ghost in the Machine.description: You gain the Wired capability. Electronics you are occupying gradually degrade and begin to malfunction over time.

fields.value: All Xerneas Major Gifts and Shared Mortality Duo Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Dark Void.title: Pact Gift - Dark Void
Pact Gift - Dark Void.description: You learn the Move Dark Void.

Pact Gift - Crush Grip.title: Pact Gift - Crush Grip
Pact Gift - Crush Grip.description: You learn the Move Crush Grip.

Pact Gift - Bolt Strike.title: Pact Gift - Bolt Strike

fields.value: All Zekrom and Shared Tao Trio Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Bolt Strike.description: You learn the Move Bolt Strike.

Pact Gift - Blue Flare.title: Pact Gift - Blue Flare

fields.value: All Reshiram and Shared Tao Trio Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift - Blue Flare.description: You learn the Move Blue Flare.

fields.value: All Lugia and Shared Tower Duo Major Gifts
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift.title: Pact Gift

fields.value: All of your Patron’s Major Gifts, GM Permission
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pact Gift.description: You gain your Patron’s Pact Gift. Lower Pantheon Legendaries do not have Pact Gifts.

Pack Tactics.title: Pack Tactics

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
fields.name: Target

Pack Tactics.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and gains the Pack Hunt or Teamwork Ability. You may target a Pokémon with Pack Tactics only once.

Pack Master.title: Pack Master

fields.value: Pack Tactics, Expert Stealth, Expert Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Pack Master.description: For you and your Pokémon with Teamwork, Teamwork's effect now reads "While you are adjacent to an opponent, allies targeting that opponent receive a +2 bonus to Accuracy Checks". Whenever you or your Pokémon successfully hit a foe with Pack Hunt, they gain a +2 Bonus to Accuracy Rolls and a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls against that foe until the end of their next turn.

PK Omega.title: PK Omega
PK Omega.description: You learn the Moves Telekinesis and Psychic.

PK Combat.title: PK Combat
PK Combat.description: You may also wield weapons and items with your Telekinesis capability, as long as you are able to lift them. This means you may use Items and Melee Weapons that normally require you to be adjacent to your target at a range limited only by your Telekinesis. When wielding Weapons with your Telekinesis, you qualify for Moves using Focus instead of Combat and may add your Special Attack instead of your Attack Stat. The Attacks remain Physical, however.

PK Alpha.title: PK Alpha
PK Alpha.description: You learn the Moves Kinesis and Barrier.

Overwatch.title: Overwatch
Overwatch.description: Create a Line X, and place a Blast 3 with at least three meters overlapping the Line's area. X is equal to your Weapon's Range. For one full round, if a foe moves in or out of that area, you may make a Ranged Weapon attack, Frequency allowing, against that foe as a Free Ac- tion. You may not attack a specific foe more than once per round this way. While this is in effect, if you Move from your current location, Overwatch's effect is lost.

Overrun.title: Overrun

fields.value: Conqueror’s March, Expert Acrobatics or Athletics
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Mount with Run Up makes a Damage Roll for a Dash or Pass Move
fields.name: Trigger

Overrun.description: Your Pokémon adds their Speed Stat in addition to their normal attacking Stat to their Damage Roll. The target gains Damage Reduction against this attack equal to their own Speed Stat.

Overload.title: Overload
Overload.description: While this Feature is Bound, whenever the target hits a foe with an Electric Attack, they may choose to have the foe lose Hit Points equal to the target's Tick value plus your Type-Linked Skill Rank. If they do, the target loses a Tick of Hit Points after the attack is resolved.

Overgrowth.title: Overgrowth

fields.value: You hit with a Druid Move
fields.name: Trigger

Overgrowth.description: One target of the triggering Move is afflicted with Overgrowth. As long as the target is afflicted, they are one step less Resistant to Grass-Type attacks, to a maximum of neutral damage, and they cannot recover Hit Points or gain Temporary Hit Points. Whenever they would do so, you gain those Hit Points or Temporary Hit Points instead. Overgrowth is removed when the target Takes a Breather or is hit by a damaging Fire, Ice, Poison, Flying, or Bug-Type attack. Overgrowth may only affect a target once per Scene.

Overclock.title: Overclock
Overclock.description: The target is cured of all Persistent Statuses, resets all negative Combat Stages to default, and gains two Ticks of Temporary Hit Points. For the rest of the Scene, it deals and takes additional damage with all attacks equal to your Technology Education Rank.

Outmaneuver.title: Outmaneuver
Outmaneuver.description: Add half your Evasion to your Accuracy Roll for the attack, and all foes hit by the attack have their Initia- tive reduced by your full Evasion value.

One With the Winds.title: One With the Winds
One With the Winds.description: You summon a windy breeze that follows you around. Your sense of touch is extended through this wind, and you can guide it by thought, using it to perceive the shape and texture of objects as long as the wind can reach, even through very small cracks and holes. The range of this effect is equal to your Acrobatics Rank plus Perception Rank in meters.

Oceanic Feeling.title: Oceanic Feeling

fields.value: Water’s Shroud, Master Athletics or Acrobatics
fields.name: Prerequisites

Oceanic Feeling.description: You may activate Oceanic Feeling when either Wash Away or Storm Drain would be triggered to gain that Ability for 1 full round, if you do not already have it, and immediately Trigger it. Activating an Ability this way ignores its usual Frequency. You may use each Ability once per Scene this way.

Observation Party.title: Observation Party
Observation Party.description: While they are in a Location in your Travel Archive, your Pokémon have the Ability you chose when gaining Travel Archive and gain a +2 bonus to Perception Checks to notice the environment.

Nurse.title: Nurse
Nurse.description:
During this Extended Rest, Pokémon and Trainers in your care gain the benefits listed below. The AP Drain cost from triggering this Feature is applied after the Extended Rest is completed and AP Drain has otherwise been restored.
» They heal 1/8th of their Max Hit Points per half hour of rest instead of 1/16th (does not stack with Bandages).
» If the Extended Rest lasts at least 6 hours, they may remove 1 Injury.

Null Error.title: Null Error
Null Error.description: You learn the Moves Disable and Snatch.

Nuanced Performance.title: Nuanced Performance

fields.value: Coordinator, Expert Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon miss all targets with a Move
fields.name: Trigger

Nuanced Performance.description: That Move's Frequency is not expended. This does not work with Moves that may fail to activate, such as moves with the Execute keyword.

Not Yet!.title: Not Yet!

fields.value: Enduring Soul, Expert Athletics or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon is Fainted, but is not at less than -100% Hit Points.
fields.name: Trigger

Not Yet!.description: Before fainting, the targeted Pokémon gains an Injury, and may then use a Move as an Interrupt. When the Move is resolved, the Pokémon then immediately faints. This consumes a Pokémon turn as normal. This cannot be used with the Moves Explosion, Pain Split, or Self-Destruct.

Noise Complaint.title: Noise Complaint
Noise Complaint.description: You learn the Moves Uproar and Hyper Voice.

Noblesse Oblige.title: Noblesse Oblige
Noblesse Oblige.description: You gain the Regal Challenge Ability.

Ninja's Arsenal.title: Ninja's Arsenal
Ninja's Arsenal.description: You may craft an Antidote, Smoke Ball, Caltrops, or Toxic Caltrops for $100.

Ninja.title: Ninja
Ninja.description: You learn the Moves Double Team and Poison Powder.

Nimble Steps.title: Nimble Steps
Nimble Steps.description: You may perform the Disengage Maneuver as a Swift Action.

New Normal.title: New Normal

fields.value: Extra Ordinary, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a Normal-Type Move with conditional modifiers which increase or decrease its damage
fields.name: Trigger

New Normal.description: You use the highest damage value for the triggering Move. (Examples: Return is DB 9, Wring Out never has its damage decreased due to the target's Hit Points, Retaliate is DB 14) New Normal may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon. New Normal may not raise a Move's Damage Base above 14; if a Move would have its Damage Base raised above that value, it is instead raised to 14.

Nature's Embrace.title: Nature's Embrace
Nature's Embrace.description: You learn 2 Moves chosen from the list below, marked with the Rank of this Feature you are gaining or lower.

Natural Fighter.title: Natural Fighter

Mystic Defense.title: Mystic Defense
Mystic Defense.description: You learn the Moves Light Screen and Safeguard.

My Kung-Fu is Stronger.title: My Kung-Fu is Stronger

fields.value: A foe provokes an Attack of Opportunity
fields.name: Trigger

My Kung-Fu is Stronger.description: You may use Rock Smash instead of an unarmed Struggle Attack. If you do, Rock Smash's Effect Range is increased by +2.

fields.value:
Musician Songs can be triggered one of four ways. Regardless of the Area of Effect, Songs always affect the user.
» When using a Move with the Sonic keyword, Songs may be triggered as a Swift Action, and the Song’s Area of Effect is the same as the triggering Move’s.
» When using a Dance Move, Songs may be triggered as a Shift Action with an Area of Effect of Burst 2.
» As a Standard Action, you may trigger one Song, with an Area of Effect of Burst 4.
» As a Full Action, you may trigger two Songs, each with an Area of Effect of Burst 4.
fields.name: Mechanic: Songs

Musical Ability.title: Musical Ability
Musical Ability.description: Choose Drown Out or Soundproof. You gain the chosen Ability.

Multi-Tasking.title: Multi-Tasking
Multi-Tasking.description: You may take two Standard Actions instead of one this turn, but both actions must have an At-Will Frequency.

Mt. Moon Blues.title: Mt. Moon Blues
Mt. Moon Blues.description: You learn the Moves Sing and Supersonic

Move Tutor.title: Move Tutor

fields.value: Mentor, one Mentor Skill at Expert Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points.
fields.name: Target

Move Tutor.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and learns any move from its Tutor List.

Move Sync.title: Move Sync

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
fields.name: Target

Move Sync.description: The target loses 1 Tutor Point. Pick a Move in the target's Move List. The picked move is now permanently your Chosen Type, and may have different effects. See the Types Changes section (page 468) for more information and suggestions. A Pokémon may have only one Move-Sync'd Move in their Move List at a time; to Sync a new Move, the old Move must be forgotten.

Moment of Action.title: Moment of Action
Moment of Action.description: Each target gains 1 Temporary Action Point. These Action Points disappear after one full Round.

Mold the Earth.title: Mold the Earth

fields.value: Your Pokémon with the Groundshaper Capability uses a Ground-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Mold the Earth.description: Your Pokémon may use the Groundshaper Capability as a Free Action. When used this way, Groundshaper creates Spike Hazards in each square turned into Rough or Slow Terrain. If you wish, instead of Groundshaper's normal range, you may choose to affect the square targeted by the attack and all cardinally adjacent squares. If the triggering Move is a Burst, Blast, Line, or Cone, you may choose to affect all squares in the targeted area instead.

Mobilize.title: Mobilize
Mobilize.description: The target cannot provoke Attacks of Opportunity on their next turn. Mobilize may target an Ally only once per encounter.

Mixed Messages.title: Mixed Messages

fields.value: Provocateur, two Provocateur Skills at Adept Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Mixed Messages.description: You learn the Moves Lovely Kiss and Torment.

Mindbreak.title: Mindbreak

fields.value: Psionic Sponge, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Mindbreak.description: While this Feature is Bound, the target's damaging Psychic-Type Moves gain a +1 Bonus to Effect Range and a +3 Bonus to Damage Rolls for each of the following conditions that the target is suffering: Bad Sleep, Confusion, Curse, Disabled, Flinch, Infatuation, Rage, or Suppression.

Miasmic Spray.title: Miasmic Spray

fields.value: Miasma’s Call, Master Stealth or Guile
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit with Acid, Clear Smog, Sludge Bomb, Sludge Wave, or Toxic; or use Acid Armor.
fields.name: Trigger

Miasmic Spray.description:
The Effect of this feature depends on the triggering move.
»Acid
»Clear Smog
»Sludge Bomb
»Sludge Wave
»Toxic
»Acid Armor

Miasmic.title: Miasmic

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Poison), Novice Stealth, Novice Guile
fields.name: Prerequisites

Miasmic.description: You learn the Moves Acid and Clear Smog.

Miasma's Call.title: Miasma's Call

fields.value: Vile Body, Expert Stealth or Guile
fields.name: Prerequisites

Miasma's Call.description: You learn the moves Acid Armor and Sludge Bomb.

Miasma Unleashed.title: Miasma Unleashed

fields.value: Miasma’s Call, Master Stealth or Guile
fields.name: Prerequisites

Miasma Unleashed.description: You learn the moves Sludge Wave and Toxic.

Miasma.title: Miasma

fields.value: Potent Venom, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon misses with a Poison-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Miasma.description: Your Pokémon may use either Smokescreen or Poison Gas as if they were on their Move List. When used this way, these Moves ignore Frequency Limitations, and are used as a Ranged Blast 3, with the blast centered on the square targeted by the triggering attack. Poison-Type Pokémon are not negatively affected by Smoke Screens created this way. Your Pokémon may also trigger Miasma deliberately as a Standard Action.

Mettle.title: Mettle

fields.value: You take Massive Damage or Intercept a Damaging Attack.
fields.name: Target

Mettle.description: Resolve Damage as if the triggering attack was resisted one step. The triggering foe then loses 2 Combat Stages in the Attack Stat used by the triggering Attack.

Metamagic.title: Metamagic
Metamagic.description: You may apply a Rank 1 Power Manipulation to your attack.

Messiah.title: Messiah
Messiah.description: Your Connection with one of your Patrons has reached such a point that even you are capable of performing the miracles they are renowned and worshiped for. Expending a use of Messiah allows you to perform such a miracle. For example, in a Region where Shaymin is known to restore withered forests to their former glory, a Touched who is a Messiah of Shaymin might be able to cause a forest to start to rapidly recover from the a ermath of a wildfire. Such acts are usually, but not always, noticeably supernatural and divine.

Mentor.title: Mentor

fields.value: Two of Charm, Intimidate, Intuition, or Pokémon Education at Novice Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point remaining
fields.name: Target

Mentor.description: The target loses 1 Tutor Point, and then learns a move from its tutor list marked with a (N), or any move on its level-up list learned at X Level or lower, where X is the target's current Level plus the sum of your Mentor Skill Ranks. Note that despite being Tutored, these Moves count as if they were "natural" for organizational purposes.

Mental Resistance.title: Mental Resistance
Mental Resistance.description: You gain the Mindlock Capability and 10 Damage Reduction against Special Psychic, Ghost, and Dark-Type damage.

Mental Assault.title: Mental Assault
Mental Assault.description: You learn the Moves Extrasensory and Psyshock.

Menace.title: Menace

fields.value: You hit a foe with the Terrorize Manipulation
fields.name: Trigger

Menace.description: Until their next turn, the target has their Initiative lowered to 0. For one full round, attacks against them cause them to Flinch on 17+ or have their existing Flinch Range increased by +4.

Medicinal Blend.title: Medicinal Blend

fields.value: You fuse the two Ingredients, creating an Item that has the properties of both. If you choose two Restoratives, they cannot be Restoratives with the same effect (you could not for example, mix a Potion and a Super Potion). If a Restorative Patch is used as an Ingredient, the resulting item can only be used as an Extended Action.
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: You or your Pokémon make a roll
fields.name: Trigger

Medicinal Blend.description: Ingredients: Two Restoratives, or a Restorative and an X-Item

Medical Techniques.title: Medical Techniques
Medical Techniques.description: The target of the triggering action gains a Tick of Hit Points, plus an additional amount of Hit Points equal to your Medicine Education Rank.

Medic.title: Medic
Medic.description: You are always considered to have access to a First Aid Manual and a Combat Medic's Primer, and are always considered to be Binding their Rank 1 Effects without actually using any AP.

Master of Arms.title: Master of Arms
Master of Arms.description: You learn the Call to Arms and Unlimited Steel Works Talents.

Martial Training.title: Martial Training
Martial Training.description: Learn two Martial Artist Moves. You may choose any Move marked with the Martial Training Rank you are taking or lower. You must meet a Move's Prerequisites to choose that Move.

Martial Artist.title: Martial Artist
Martial Artist.description: Choose one of the abilities listed below. You gain the chosen Ability, and its associated tags. Whenever you gain any Martial Artist Feature, you also gain the associated tags.

Martial Achievement.title: Martial Achievement
Martial Achievement.description: You gain a Martial Achievement based on your Chosen Ability.

Marsh Stomper.title: Marsh Stomper – Wetland Terrain
Marsh Stomper.description: You can handle the toxic fauna and flora of the marshes. You do not lose Hit Points from Poison and lose only 1 instead of 2 Combat Stages from Poison. You still count as Poisoned for the purpose of Moves and effects.

Marksman Orders.title: Marksman Orders
Marksman Orders.description: You gain the Trick Shot and Long Shot Orders.

Mark of Vision.title: Mark of Vision
Mark of Vision.description: You mark the target with a mystical power which allows you to close your eyes and focus to perceive the world with their senses from their perspective. You may Bind this Ability multiple times, each time on a different target, but you may only concentrate on one Mark of Vision at a time, and you may only have a number of Marks at one time equal to half your Perception Rank. A target may choose to end this effect at any time, or to deny you access to their senses temporarily without ending the effect entirely. You have a rough sense of how far away and in what direction marked targets are.

Man of Steel.title: Man of Steel
Man of Steel.description: You learn the Moves Meteor Mash and King's Shield. You may use these Moves as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.

Malice.title: Malice
Malice.description: You learn the Moves Mean Look and Chip Away.

Malediction.title: Malediction

fields.value: Hex Maniac Studies Rank 1, Expert Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A foe within 5 meters misses all targets with an attack
fields.name: Trigger

Malediction.description: Use a Status-Class Move gained from Hex Maniac Studies targeting the triggering foe as a Free Action, Frequency-permitting.

Major Gift - Winter's Kiss.title: Major Gift - Winter's Kiss

fields.value: Minor Gift - Elemental Soul OR Major Gift - The Empty Tao
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Winter's Kiss.description: You gain the Winter's Kiss Ability.

fields.value: All allies within 5 meters may choose to increase all movement speeds by 2, raise their Attack and Special Attack Stats by 1 Combat Stage, and decrease their Accuracy by 2 for the next three rounds.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Water Absorb.title: Major Gift - Water Absorb
Major Gift - Water Absorb.description: You gain the Water Absorb Ability.

Major Gift - Volt Absorb.title: Major Gift - Volt Absorb
Major Gift - Volt Absorb.description: You gain the Volt Absorb Ability.

Major Gift - Victory Star.title: Major Gift - Victory Star
Major Gift - Victory Star.description: You gain the Victory Star Ability.

Major Gift - Tower's Blessing.title: Major Gift - Tower's Blessing

fields.value: The Move generates one additional use of the Blessing.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Tower's Blessing.description: Trigger: You or your Pokémon use a Move with the Blessing Keyword

Major Gift - Touch of the Flayed One.title: Major Gift – Touch of the Flayed One
Major Gift - Touch of the Flayed One.description: Trigger: You inflict Injuries on a Target.

Major Gift - Time Stop.title: Major Gift - Time Stop
Major Gift - Time Stop.description: Take an additional Shift Action and Standard Action.

fields.value: Create an extra stat block for yourself, redistributing any Stat Points you gained from level ups or [+Any Stat] tags as you wish. You may activate this Major Gift during an encounter to swap your stats to the extra stat block for the rest of the encounter. Therian Form may be ended early at any time as a Standard Action. Therian Form automatically deactivates if you Faint. While Therian Form is active, you take on slight Avian, Bestial, or Draconic characteristics depending on your patron Legendary.
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: For the next three rounds, all Pokémon and Trainers within 5 meters of you have all Combat Stages locked to zero.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Sun Blanket.title: Major Gift - Sun Blanket
Major Gift - Sun Blanket.description: You gain the Sun Blanket Ability.

Major Gift - Storm of the Fallen World.title: Major Gift - Storm of the Fallen World

fields.value: For 5 rounds, the area becomes Bugged. While Bugged, all combatants are treated as if they have had the Move Heal Block applied to them, all combatants become Typeless and all effects deal only Typeless damage. At the beginning of each round, all combatants lose 1/16th of their maximum Hit Points.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Storm of the Century.title: Major Gift - Storm of the Century

fields.value: At the beginning of your next three turns, push all foes within 5 meters of you 1 meter away, and they lose a Tick of HP.
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: Minor Gift - Catastrophe Sense OR Minor Gift - Plant Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Exchange the positions of up to three target Pokémon or Trainers within 10 meters.
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: To use Sky Spirit, the current Weather must be Clear as a result of Defog or Air Lock. For the next five rounds, foes within 10 meters of you have their Sky and Levitate Capabilities halved. Allies within 10 meters of you add 10 to their Initiative.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Sight Sharing.title: Major Gift - Sight Sharing

fields.value: Minor Gift - Loyal Heart, See Effect
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Sight Sharing.description: You must take this Major Gift alongside another person also taking this Major Gift, one of you gaining it through Latias and the other through Latios. The two of you are considered Link Partners. Whenever you wish, you may share your senses with your Link Partner or attempt to use their senses as long as both you and your Link Partner give mental consent and are conscious. You and your Link Partner never hit each other with Area of Effect Moves unless you want to.

Major Gift - Shatter Memory.title: Major Gift - Shatter Memory

fields.value: Choose an effect: The Target has one Ability disabled at random or two Moves disabled at random for the remainder of the Encounter. Additionally, the Target must make a Focus Check with DC 10 to recall complex thoughts and memories for the next fifteen minutes. The target becomes immune to further uses of Shatter Memory for 24 hours.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Shatter Memory.description: Target: Pokémon or Trainer within 8 meters

Major Gift - Shared Mortality.title: Major Gift - Shared Mortality

fields.value: Add your remaining Hit Points with those of your Target. You may split these Hit Points as you wish between you and your Target.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Shared Mortality.description: Target: An Allied Pokémon or Trainer.

Major Gift - Seed Flare.title: Major Gift - Seed Flare

fields.value: Major Gift - Pure Breathing, Major Gift - Sprouter
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Seed Flare.description: You learn the Move Seed Flare.

fields.value: For the next 5 minutes you can see networks as a visual overlay when you look at people communicating electronically. You view this in the form of lines of light arcing from devices to the other devices they are communicating with.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Searing Blade.title: Major Gift - Searing Blade
Major Gift - Searing Blade.description: Your next Struggle Attack with an equipped weapon deals +2 Damage Steps and deals Fire Type damage.

Major Gift - Sacred Sword.title: Major Gift - Sacred Sword
Major Gift - Sacred Sword.description: You learn the Move Sacred Sword.

Major Gift - Relic Song.title: Major Gift - Relic Song
Major Gift - Relic Song.description: You learn the Move Relic Song.

fields.value: You open a small portal through your patron’s realm to any location you have visited within 20 miles. The portal lasts for two minutes, during which any living thing which voluntarily wishes to enter the portal may do so; any conscious trainers or Pokémon forced through the portal involuntarily will not be affected by the portal. After the two minutes are up or when you step through the portal, it collapses.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Pure Breathing.title: Major Gift - Pure Breathing
Major Gift - Pure Breathing.description: You are immune to the Moves Rage Powder, Poison Gas, Poisonpowder, Sleep Powder, Smog, Smokescreen, Spore, Stun Spore, and Sweet Scent.

Major Gift - Probability Control.title: Major Gift - Probability Control

fields.value: Minor Gift - Catastrophe Sense OR Minor Gift - Perfect Timing
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Probability Control.description: You gain the Probability Control Ability.

Major Gift - Primal Craftsmanship.title: Major Gift - Primal Craftsmanship

fields.value: Minor Gift - Hands of the Creator
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Primal Craftsmanship.description: You pay 20% less when crafting items.

Major Gift - Oneiromancy.title: Major Gift - Oneiromancy
Major Gift - Oneiromancy.description: You gain the Dream Reader Capability.

Major Gift - Nomad.title: Major Gift - Nomad
Major Gift - Nomad.description: You gain the Transporter Ability. Note that this automatically grants you the Move Teleport.

Major Gift - Negate Emotion.title: Major Gift - Negate Emotion

fields.value: The Target becomes immune to Enraged, Confused, and Infatuation Status for the remainder of the encounter and are cured of the Status Afflictions if they currently have them. However, the Target is treated as if their Intimidate, Charm, Intuition and Guile Skills were at Pathetic Rank for the next fifteen minutes. The target becomes immune to further uses of Negate Emotion for 24 hours.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Negate Emotion.description: Target: Pokémon or Trainer within 8 meters

Major Gift - Mist Ball.title: Major Gift - Mist Ball
Major Gift - Mist Ball.description: You learn the Move Mist Ball.

fields.value: You create a small Illusion, covering a cubic area two meters on each side. The Illusion can emulate visual and auditory senses only. Seeing through the Illusion is a DC 15 Perception Check, with a +5 bonus to the check if the Illusion is emulating something very familiar to the observer. The Illusion may be sustained for up to ten minutes as a Swift Action each round.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Mind Lock.title: Major Gift - Mind Lock
Major Gift - Mind Lock.description: You gain the Mind Lock Capability.

Major Gift - Mental Suggestion.title: Major Gift – Mental Suggestion
Major Gift - Mental Suggestion.description: Mental Suggestion requires both you and the Mewtwo you are bound to be in the same vicinity. Make a Focus check as if you were using Telepath. On a success, you instill a thought or action into the Target’s mind as if it were one of their own. They may not immediately act on it, and will question it if it is too alien from how they would normally act, but the thought will persist as long as they are unaware of its origin.

fields.value: Treat the Target as if it were one Loyalty higher for the rest of this turn.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - March of the Colossus.title: Major Gift - March of the Colossus

fields.value: For the next three rounds, the target has their Attack and Speed halved. At the end of the third round, increase the target’s Attack and Speed by two Combat Stages each.
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: Minor Gift - Hands of the Creator
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: For the next three rounds, foes within 6 meters of you do not gain the benefits of Sunny Day. Their Fire Type Moves do not deal extra damage, Solar Beam retains the default charge time, Abilities based on Sunny Weather do not activate, and Moves such as Synthesis do not gain added benefit. All detrimental effects of Sunny Day still apply.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Magma Armor.title: Major Gift - Magma Armor
Major Gift - Magma Armor.description: You gain the Magma Armor Ability.

Major Gift - Magic Bounce.title: Major Gift - Magic Bounce
Major Gift - Magic Bounce.description: You gain the Magic Bounce Ability.

Major Gift - Luster Purge.title: Major Gift - Luster Purge
Major Gift - Luster Purge.description: You learn the Move Luster Purge.

Major Gift - Lightning Rod.title: Major Gift - Lightning Rod
Major Gift - Lightning Rod.description: You gain the Lightning Rod Ability.

Major Gift - Life Force.title: Major Gift - Life Force

fields.value: Two Major Gifts from the Tower Duo
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Life Force.description: You gain the Life Force Ability.

Major Gift - Lava-blooded.title: Major Gift - Lava-blooded
Major Gift - Lava-blooded.description: Static Effect: You are immune to the ambient heat of volcanic areas. Unless you come into direct contact with molten rock, you will not be harmed. You resist Fire Type Moves by one step.

Major Gift - Knight of the Fallen God.title: Major Gift - Knight of the Fallen God
Major Gift - Knight of the Fallen God.description: You gain the Giftsapper Feature regardless of prerequisites, and you are not bound by its requirements with respect to Gifts. Giftsapper when gained this way has no effect on Gifts granted by MissingNo.

fields.value: The area becomes Inverted for the next 5 rounds. While Inverted, all Pokémon and Trainers have their weaknesses and resistances exchanged. Double resistance and steps of resistance or immunity beyond that become double weaknesses, normal resistances become normal weaknesses, normal weaknesses become normal resistances, and double weaknesses become double resistance.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Heart Swap.title: Major Gift - Heart Swap
Major Gift - Heart Swap.description: You learn the Move Heart Swap.

Major Gift - He Who Cannot Be Shackled.title: Major Gift – He Who Cannot Be Shackled

fields.value: You evade the Status Effect or Combat Maneuver.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - He Who Cannot Be Shackled.description: Trigger: You become Trapped, Slowed, Tripped or Grappled.

Major Gift - God Crusher.title: Major Gift – God Crusher
Major Gift - God Crusher.description: You gain the Godslayer Feature. If you already possess the Godslayer Feature, you may instead take another Feature for which you qualify for instead. When using Godslayer, the AC is now 8, and you do not suffer from feedback.

fields.value: You must use Glitch Message targeting one instance of electronic communication you are currently aware of in your vicinity, such as an email being typed at the computer next to you or a text message someone is sending. You may view and edit the contents of the message before it gets electronically transmitted without the sender being aware of an issue. On extended communications such as a phone call or video conference, Glitch Message works on one minute’s worth of communication per activation.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Gentle Vibe.title: Major Gift - Gentle Vibe
Major Gift - Gentle Vibe.description: You gain the Gentle Vibe Ability.

Major Gift - Flash Fire.title: Major Gift - Flash Fire
Major Gift - Flash Fire.description: You gain the Flash Fire Ability.

Major Gift - Fairy Aura.title: Major Gift - Fairy Aura
Major Gift - Fairy Aura.description: You gain the Fairy Aura Ability.

fields.value: You can determine whether or not a professed desire by the Target is being sought for altruistic reasons or not.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Expanded Horizons.title: Major Gift – Expanded Horizons
Major Gift - Expanded Horizons.description: You gain either the Telepath or Telekinetic Capability. If you possess both of these from their respected Trainer Classes, you instead gain the Godslayer Feature.

Major Gift - Elemental Manipulation.title: Major Gift - Elemental Manipulation
Major Gift - Elemental Manipulation.description: You gain a Capability based on which Legendary Bird or Beast granted you this Feature. Articuno grants Freezer, Moltres and Entei grant Firestarter, Zapdos and Raikou grant Zapper, and Suicune grants Fountain.

fields.value: Major Gift - Oneiromancy, Major Gift - Dream Augury
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You fall into a deep sleep and have a dream that portends of things to come. If this Major Gift is gained through Cresselia, you learn hints of a favorable situation that will arise soon. If this Major Gift is gained through Darkrai, you learn hints of a dangerous or mournful situation that will arise soon.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Drain Will.title: Major Gift - Drain Will

fields.value: You and the Target make opposed Focus Checks. If you win the Check, the Target is unable to take Shift or Standard Actions for their next 1d2 turns. Regardless of whether or not you won the Check, the Target suffers a -3 penalty to all rolls for the rest of the encounter, or for fifteen minutes outside of combat. The target becomes immune to further uses of Drain Will for 24 hours.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Drain Will.description: Target: Pokémon or Trainer within 8 meters

Major Gift - Doom Desire.title: Major Gift - Doom Desire
Major Gift - Doom Desire.description: You learn the Move Doom Desire.

Major Gift - Diamond Storm.title: Major Gift - Diamond Storm
Major Gift - Diamond Storm.description: You learn the Move Diamond Storm.

fields.value: For the next ten minutes, all wireless communication within ten meters of you fails to work. Radios stop receiving, WiFi shuts down, and cell signals fail to reach phones.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Dark Aura.title: Major Gift – Dark Aura

fields.value: Major Gift – Touch of the Flayed One
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Dark Aura.description: You gain the Dark Aura Ability.

Major Gift - Corrupt Existence.title: Major Gift - Corrupt Existence

fields.value: For each AP spent on Corrupt Existence up to a maximum of 3, roll 1d20. The Target becomes one step weaker against a Type for each roll as follows: Bug on a result of 1; Dark on 2; Dragon on 3; Electric on 4; Fighting on 5; Fire on 6; Flying on 7; Ghost on 8; Grass on 9; Ground on 10; Ice on 11; Normal on 12; Poison on 13; Psychic on 14; Rock on 15; Steel on 16; Water on 17; and on a result of 18-20, reroll the 1d20. This effect lasts until the end of the encounter, even if the target is recalled.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Corrupt Existence.description: Target: Trainer or Pokémon within 6 meters

Major Gift - Clear Body.title: Major Gift - Clear Body
Major Gift - Clear Body.description: You gain the Clear Body Ability.

fields.value: The Target is cured of all Injuries and Status Ailments.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Blaze Armor.title: Major Gift - Blaze Armor
Major Gift - Blaze Armor.description: You take damage from the next Attack that hits you as if you were Fire Type. If the Attack was made in melee range, your attacker loses 1/8th of their maximum HP as a Fire Type effect. Apply weakness and resistance. Do not apply stats.

fields.value: All allies within 5 meters may choose to decrease their movement speeds by 1 and raise their evasion by 2 for the next three rounds.
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: Remove a single Target within 8 meters from the encounter for 1d2+1 rounds. The Target experiences no loss of time. They reappear in the same spot that they disappeared from, or in the nearest unoccupied space.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Bad Dreams.title: Major Gift - Bad Dreams

fields.value: Major Gift - Oneiromancy, Major Gift - Dream Augury
fields.name: Prerequisites

Major Gift - Bad Dreams.description: You gain the Bad Dreams Ability.

Major Gift - Aura Break.title: Major Gift – Aura Break
Major Gift - Aura Break.description: You gain the Aura Break Ability.

Major Gift - Ashes of the Phoenix.title: Major Gift - Ashes of the Phoenix

fields.value: Treat the target as if you had used a Revive on it. The target regains 25% of its maximum HP
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: For the next three rounds, foes within 6 meters of you do not gain the benefits of Rain Dance. Their Water Type Moves do not deal extra damage, Hurricane and Thunder retain their usual Accuracy Check, Abilities based on Rainy Weather do not activate, and Moves such as Weather Ball do not gain added benefit. All detrimental effects of Rain Dance still apply.
fields.name: Effect

fields.value: Create a small golem out of the inanimate material of your choice. The material used will determine the Type of the golem. Scrap metal may create a Steel type, lava a Fire type, and granite a Rock type, for example. Distribute a number of Stat Points to the golem equal to your Trainer Level. The golem is small size, weight class 1, and has Overland 4, Jump 0/0, and Power 2. It can make Struggle Attacks of its Type. The golem must be verbally commanded by you to act. It cannot regain HP and is destroyed upon Fainting. At the end of the day or if you Faint, the golem crumbles and is destroyed.
fields.name: Effect

Major Gift - Air Lock.title: Major Gift - Air Lock
Major Gift - Air Lock.description: You gain the Air Lock Ability.

Major Gift.title: Major Gift
Major Gift.description: You gain one of your Patron’s Major Gifts. Thiis Major Gift may be of your GM’s choosing. This feat is able to be taken multiple times based on your GM’s discretion.

Magnetize.title: Magnetize
Magnetize.description: You gain the Magnetic Capability and may use this magnetism to stick to surfaces with significant met- al content (ex: metal walls obviously, concrete with met- al I-beams inside, etc). You may use your Overland to traverse any such surfaces, even if that means walking vertically up a wall or upside down on a ceiling. You may choose not to be Pushed when on such a surface.

Magical Burst.title: Magical Burst

fields.value: You must have Enchanting Transformation Bound to use Magical Burst
fields.name: Trigger

Magical Burst.description: Use a Glamour Weaver Move as if it had the range Burst 3, Friendly, Exhaust, Smite. All allies within the area-of-effect gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points or cure themselves of one Volatile Affliction. Enchanting Transformation immediately becomes Unbound, and the AP used to bind it becomes spent instead of becoming available again.

Maelstrom.title: Maelstrom

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Water), Novice Athletics, Novice Acrobatics
fields.name: Prerequisites

Maelstrom.description: You gain the Gilled Capability, and a +2 bonus to your Swim speed. Whenever your Water-Type Moves miss all targets, you gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.

Macho Charge.title: Macho Charge

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Tough-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value: All targets hit by the Move are pushed away from the triggering Pokémon by 3 meters. You may activate Macho Charge only once per Pokémon per Scene.
fields.name: In Battles

Macho Charge.description: In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.

Luminous Aura.title: Luminous Aura

fields.value: Blinding Brightness, Adept Charm or General Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Luminous Aura.description: Choose Starlight or Sunglow. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Lucky Clover Grand Finale.title: Lucky Clover Grand Finale

fields.value: Passionato Harmony, Master Charm or Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Lucky Clover Grand Finale.description: You learn the Moves Moonblast and Aromatic Mist.

Look and Learn.title: Look and Learn

fields.value: Hobbyist, Expert General Education or Perception
fields.name: Prerequisites

Look and Learn.description: When you activate Look and Learn, you may gain any of the Features below even though they are Features from other Classes. You do not need to meet their normal prerequisites, but you must meet their Prerequisites listed here. Look and Learn can be used two times; once to learn a Feature from the "Scene Features" List, and once to learn a Feature from the "Action Point Features List".

Long Shot.title: Long Shot
Long Shot.description: The target’s damaging ranged attacks have their range doubled until the end of their next turn, and deal X additional damage. X is equal to the distance in meters that the attack traveled. Long Shot does not increase the size of area of effect attacks. If attacks altered by Long Shot are Critical Hits, add the value of the Damage Dice Roll an additional time to the total damage.

Lockdown.title: Lockdown

fields.value: Your Pokémon's Damaging Electric Attack would inflict Paralysis on an already Paralyzed foe
fields.name: Trigger

Lockdown.description: For 1 full round, that foe is instead Stuck and may only use At-Will Frequency Moves.

Living Shadow.title: Living Shadow
Living Shadow.description: Your own Shadow can attack others; you may have your Dark Type Moves originate from any Square adjacent to you. If you are fighting among complete darkness, you may have your Dark Type Moves origi- nate from any square within X meters that is completely dark, where X is the higher of your Guile or Stealth Rank. Attacks originating from Living Shadow do not trigger effects that rely on being hit with a melee attack.

Lifelong Learning.title: Lifelong Learning

fields.value: Move Tutor, one Mentor Skill at Master Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Lifelong Learning.description: Your Pokémon may have up to 4 Moves from their Move List come from TMs or Move Tutors.

Let's Be Friends!.title: Let's Be Friends!
Let's Be Friends!.description: The target may attempt to improve the disposition of a Wild Pokémon as if making a Charm Check. They roll their Cute Dice from Poffins and add their number of Cute Dice from Stats as a modifier. For example, a Pokémon with 4d6 Cute from Poffins and 3d6 Cute from Speed rolls 4d6+3 in place of a Charm Check

Let Me Help You With That.title: Let Me Help You With That

fields.value: An allied Trainer fails a Skill Check in a Skill you have Ranked at Novice or higher.
fields.name: Trigger

Let Me Help You With That.description: The ally may re-roll the Skill Check with a Bonus equal to your Skill Rank.

Lessons In Rage And Pain.title: Lessons In Rage And Pain
Lessons In Rage And Pain.description: While you have at least 1 Injury, add +X to your Damage Rolls with Rage, Flail, Fury Swipes, Thrash, and Weapon Attacks. X is equal to your Intimidate Rank plus the number of Injuries you have. You do not lose Hit Points from being Heavily Injured, and Injuries beyond the 5th do not lower your Maximum Hit Points.

Lessons.title: Lessons
Lessons.description: You may perform any Mentor Lesson for which you qualify.

Learn From Your Mistakes.title: Learn From Your Mistakes

fields.value: Your Pokémon fails a Skill Check.
fields.name: Trigger

Learn From Your Mistakes.description: Your Pokémon may re-roll the Skill Check with a Bonus equal to its number of Smart Dice from Poffins.

Lean In.title: Lean In

fields.value: You and your Mount both take Damage from a Burst, Blast, Cone, or Line
fields.name: Trigger

Lean In.description: Both you and your Mount Resist the attack one step further.

Leadership.title: Leadership
Leadership.description: You may use [Orders] that have targets to target any Ally, even if normally those [Orders] would only let you apply the effect to your own Pokemon. Any other conditions still apply.

Lay on Hands.title: Lay on Hands
Lay on Hands.description: Choose Blessed Touch or Healer. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Kinjutsu.title: Kinjutsu
Kinjutsu.description: You learn the Moves Substitute and Toxic.

Keep Fighting!.title: Keep Fighting!

fields.value: Your Pokémon or an Ally Trainer with over 1 Hit Point is reduced to 0 Hit Points or lower
fields.name: Trigger

Keep Fighting!.description: That Ally's Hit Point count is reduced to 1 instead, and then gains Temporary Hit Points equal to your Charm Rank doubled.

Juggling Show.title: Juggling Show
Juggling Show.description: You may roll an additional Xd6 during the In- troduction Stage of a Contest, where X is half of your Acrobatics Rank. You may choose any Contest Stat to attempt to gain Dice for with this roll.

Juggler.title: Juggler

fields.value: Quick Switch, Novice Acrobatics, Novice Guile
fields.name: Prerequisites

Juggler.description: Using Quick Switch costs only 1 AP. Whenever you send a Pokémon into an encounter from a Poké Ball, they receive a +10 bonus to their Initiative during that round.

Jailbreaker.title: Jailbreaker
Jailbreaker.description: You may craft any Poké Ball Case Recipe for which you qualify.

Iterative Evolution.title: Iterative Evolution

fields.value: Insectoid Utility, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Iterative Evolution.description: While this Feature is bound, if your Pokémon's Bug-Type attack would deal Super-Effective Damage, it gains a +2 Bonus to Accuracy Check. If it would deal Neutral Damage, it gains a Bonus to its Damage Roll equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank. If it would be resisted, it is resisted one step less. This is calculated after applying any other effects that would modify effectiveness before the Accuracy Roll is made, such as the Tinted Lens Ability.

Item Mastery.title: Item Mastery
Item Mastery.description: You learn the Moves Fling and Recycle.

Iron Grit.title: Iron Grit

fields.value: Polished Shine, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Iron Grit.description: When this Feature becomes Bound, the target gains +1 Defense Combat Stage. While the Feature remains bound, the target's Defense Stat cannot be lowered, and its Defense Combat Stages cannot be lowered.

Inspired Training.title: Inspired Training
Inspired Training.description: The target becomes Inspired until the end of the effect duration. Inspired Pokémon gain a +1 bonus to Evasion and +2 to Save Checks.

Inspirational Support.title: Inspirational Support
Inspirational Support.description: Whenever your Pokémon with Friend Guard targets an Ally with an Ability or Status Move, the targeted Ally becomes Cheered.

Insectoid Utility.title: Insectoid Utility

fields.value: Your Pokémon has a +1 bonus to its Speed Evasion.
fields.name: Sky

Insectoid Utility.description:
Your Pokémon with the following Capabilities have the upgrades below applied to them.
» Threaded
» Wallclimber
» Naturewalk

Innovation.title: Innovation

fields.value: A Pokémon with at least 1 Tutor Point.
fields.name: Target

Innovation.description: The target loses 1 Tutor Point, and then learns a Move created with Innovation. See the next section for details on creating Moves for this Feature. A Pokémon may only have one Move created by Innovation at a time.

Incandescence.title: Incandescence

fields.value: Brightest Flame, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Incandescence.description: While this Feature is Bound, the target gains the Mixed Power Poké Edge effect when using damaging Fire-Type Attacks. If the target already has Mixed Power, they instead add their entire Attack and Special Attack Stats to all damaging Fire-Type Attacks, instead of one or the other. This does not stack with Twisted Power.

In My Name.title: In My Name

fields.value: Completed a task on behalf of your Patron, GM Permission
fields.name: Rank 2 Prerequisites

fields.value: If your Patron does not have a Pact Gift, you instead require all their Major Gifts to attain Rank 4.
fields.name: Note

In My Name.description: You acquire a Blessing marked with the In My Name Rank you are gaining or lower. You must additionally meet any Prerequisites of the Blessing.

Improvised Gadgets.title: Improvised Gadgets

fields.value: Gadgeteer Research Field, Novice Technology Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A willing Pokémon with the Magnetic, Zapper, or Threaded Capability
fields.name: Target

Improvised Gadgets.description: Choose one of the Capabilities listed in the Target line that the target Pokémon has. You create a Main or Off-Hand Equipment Item usable by Trainers that grants the user the chosen Capability. Whenever a Trainer makes Struggle Attacks using Zapper through this Item, they may choose to use your Technology Education Rank tripled in place of an offensive Stat. When this Feature is Unbound, the Equipment Item breaks and cannot be repaired. You may only have X instances of this Feature Bound at once, where X is equal to half your Technology Education Rank.

Immutable Mind.title: Immutable Mind

fields.value: You're hit by a Psychic, Ghost, or Dark-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Immutable Mind.description: If the triggering Move was a Status-Class Move, the Move fails. If the Triggering Move was a Damaging Move with a Secondary Effect that triggers on a certain roll, you are immune to the secondary effect.

I'm a Doctor.title: I'm a Doctor
I'm a Doctor.description: Each Rank, you gain one of Field Clinic or Medic Training and one of Nurse or First Aid Expertise.

I Meant to Do That.title: I Meant to Do That

fields.value: You must have at least one Equipment Item you created with Improvised Gadgets equipped to use this Feature.
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value: You may activate this effect as a Swift Action upon hitting a foe with a Zapper-modified Struggle Attack. The foe is Paralyzed.
fields.name: Zapper

I Meant to Do That.description:
Choose one of your equipped items you created with Improved Gadgets. It is destroyed and cannot be repaired, and that instance of Improvised Gadgets is immediately Unbound. Use the effect below corresponding to the Capability granted by the chosen item.
»Magnetic
»Threaded

I Am Error.title: I Am Error
I Am Error.description: Roll 1d10 and change which Status Affliction is gained according to the following chart. If the target already has that Status Affliction, roll again.

Hydro Jet.title: Hydro Jet

fields.value: You use a damaging single target Water-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Hydro Jet.description: Hydro Jet's effect depends on if the triggering Move was Melee or Ranged.

Hunter's Reflexes.title: Hunter's Reflexes
Hunter's Reflexes.description: You and your Pokémon may make up to three Attacks of Opportunity each round, instead of only one. Additionally, your attacks always consider you to be adjacent to your target for the purposes of benefiting from your Pokémon's Teamwork Ability, and count as Melee attacks for the purposes of triggering their Pack Hunt Ability.

Hunter.title: Hunter
Hunter.description: Choose Teamwork or Pack Hunt. You gain the Chosen Ability.

How To Shoot Web.title: How To Shoot Web
How To Shoot Web.description: You gain the Threaded and Wallclimber Capabilities.

Honed Mind.title: Honed Mind
Honed Mind.description: You learn the Moves Mind Reader and Calm Mind.

Hobbyist.title: Hobbyist
Hobbyist.description: You gain three Skill Edges for which you qualify. These Skill Edges must rank up a Skill.

Hits the Spot.title: Hits the Spot

fields.value: You or your Pokémon trade in a Digestion Buff
fields.name: Trigger

Hits the Spot.description: The target gains Temporary Hit Points equal to your Intuition Rank doubled. These Temporary Hit Points stack from any Temporary Hit Points granted by Accentuated Taste, the Digestion Buff or by the Lunchbox Ability.

Highly Responsive to Prayers.title: Highly Responsive to Prayers

fields.value: You use the Blessed Touch or Healer Ability on an ally, or an ally receives an Injury
fields.name: Trigger

Highly Responsive to Prayers.description: You may use the Sage Feature as a Free Action targeting the triggering ally. Multiple instances of Sage's effect that you use may stack when used this way.

Highlander.title: Highlander

fields.value: Tyrant’s Roar, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Highlander.description: While this Feature is Bound, the target gains X Damage Reduction against Dragon-Type attacks, and gain a +X Bonus to Damage Rolls with Dragon-Typed attacks against other Dragon-Typed targets. X is equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Hidden Power (Feature).title: Hidden Power (Feature)
Hidden Power (Feature).description: You learn the Move Hidden Power. Whenever you use Hidden Power, it may be either Physical or Spe- cial, adding the appropriate Attack Stat.

Hex Maniac Studies.title: Hex Maniac Studies
Hex Maniac Studies.description: Learn two Hex Maniac Moves. You may choose any Move marked with the Hex Maniac Studies Rank you are taking or lower.

Hex Maniac.title: Hex Maniac
Hex Maniac.description: Choose Cursed Body or Omen. You gain the Chosen Ability

Hero's Journey.title: Hero's Journey
Hero's Journey.description: Each Rank, you may gain two Backpacker Talents for which you qualify.

Herb Lore.title: Herb Lore

fields.value: A Sitrus Berry or Tiny Mushroom creates x2 Energy Powders. An Energy Root creates x3 Energy Powders.
fields.name: Energy Powder

fields.value: A Lum Berry or Big Mushroom creates x2 Heal Powders. A Revival Herb creates x3 Heal Powders
fields.name: Heal Powder

fields.value: x1 Energy Powder and x1 Heal Powder create x3 Poultices.
fields.name: Poultice

Herb Lore.description: You may create Energy Powder, Heal Powder, or Poultices from ingredients, as listed below.

Herald of Pride.title: Herald of Pride

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Dragon), Novice Command, Novice Intimidate
fields.name: Prerequisites

Herald of Pride.description: When wielding Melee Weapons, you may use Command or Intimidate instead of Combat to determine the Damage Base of your Struggle Attacks, to resist Disarm Maneuvers, and to qualify for a Weapon's Moves. Your Weapon Attacks ignore Damage Reduction up to your Command or Intimidate Rank.

Heart of Darkness.title: Heart of Darkness

fields.value: Sharpen Shadows, Master Guile or Stealth
fields.name: Prerequisites

Heart of Darkness.description: You learn Night Daze and Punishment

Haunting Curse.title: Haunting Curse

fields.value: Ghost Step, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Haunting Curse.description:
While this Feature is bound, the target gains a Curse Token each time they use a Ghost-Type Move or Ghost Step. Ghost-Type Moves with a Set-Up and Resolution Phase give a Curse Token for each Phase. As a Standard Action during their turn, or as Free Action upon Fainting, the target may spend their Curse Tokens to apply conditions to a foe within 6 meters.
» 1 Curse Token
» 2 Curse Tokens
» 3 Curse Tokens
» 4 Curse Tokens

Haunted Wounds.title: Haunted Wounds

fields.value: Shadow Arms, Master Intimidate or Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit with an Apparition Move or Ghost- Typed Weapon Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Haunted Wounds.description: After one full round, repeat the triggering attack against one target as a Free Action, regardless of range. If this attack hits, it deals damage as if it were resisted one step further. Haunted Wounds may only affect a target once per Scene.

Harrier.title: Harrier

fields.value: You hit a foe with a damaging Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Harrier.description: Until the end of your next turn, that foe is con- sidered Flanked, is Slowed, and cannot take actions as Priority or Interrupt. Harrier may only be used on a foe once per Scene.

Guidance.title: Guidance
Guidance.description: Your Pokémon's base Move List Limit is increased by +1 (Reminder: The default Move List Limit is 6).

Guardian's Punishment.title: Guardian's Punishment

fields.value: You hit a Marked Foe with a Damaging Weapon Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Guardian's Punishment.description: Add your Defense Stat to the Damage Roll. The Marked Foe takes a penalty to Damage Rolls equal to your Combat or Focus Rank for 1 full round.

Guardian Orders.title: Guardian Orders
Guardian Orders.description: You gain the Brace for Impact and Sentinel Stance Orders.

Ground Out.title: Ground Out

fields.value: Earth Shaker, Expert Focus or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

Ground Out.description: Pick two of Drill Run, Magnitude, or Mud Bomb. You learn the chosen Moves.

Green Path.title: Green Path
Green Path.description: You gain the Naturewalk (Grassland) and Naturewalk (Forest) capabilities, and you are immune to Moves with the Powder keyword.

Gravel Before Me.title: Gravel Before Me

fields.value: Your Rock-Type Pokémon misses all targets with a Rock-Type attack, receives an Injury, suffers a Critical Hit, or Faints.
fields.name: Trigger

Gravel Before Me.description: Create a Stealth Rock Hazard adjacent to your Pokémon.

Grand Hex.title: Grand Hex

fields.value: Hex Maniac Studies Rank 3, Master Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit a foe with Hex
fields.name: Trigger

Grand Hex.description: Regain one use of a Move gained from Hex Maniac Studies that can inflict a Status Affliction that the triggering target has. If you activated the conditional damage boost for Hex, its Frequency is not expended. You may only activate Grand Hex once per target per Scene.

Gotta Catch 'Em All.title: Gotta Catch 'Em All
Gotta Catch 'Em All.description: Every time you Capture a Wild Pokémon that is a member of an evolutionary family of which you own no other Pokémon, you gain 1 Collector Stack. Whenever you make a Capture Roll, you may spend up to three Collector Stacks to gain an equal bonus to your Capture Roll, or you may spend three Collector Stacks to re-roll entirely.

Godslayer.title: Godslayer
Godslayer.description: You may attempt to shatter one of the target’s Legendary Auras. The AC of this action is 10. If you successfully disabled the Aura, but rolled a 10-15, the feedback from the action gives you an Injury.

Go, Fight, Win!.title: Go, Fight, Win!

fields.value: All allies on the field gain a +2 bonus to Evasion for one full Round.
fields.name: I Believe In You!

Go, Fight, Win!.description:
Choose and perform one of the cheers below. You may perform each Cheer only once per Scene.
» Show Your Best!
» Don't Stop Now!

Gneiss Aim.title: Gneiss Aim

fields.value: Gravel Before Me, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon misses with a Damaging Rock- Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Gneiss Aim.description: The Move gains the Smite keyword for that use.

Glyph.title: Glyph

fields.value: Your Unown that is not part of a Prime Unown
fields.name: Target

Glyph.description: You may set the target Unown against any flat surface, and turn the Unown into a glyph. Glyphs have HP equal to your Level, and no other stats. Glyphs last until they are destroyed or intentionally de-activated, at which time the Unown returns to Unown Space, dis- appearing forever. You may have a number of active Glyphs equal to your Occult Education Rank. When setting a Glyph, you may have the Glyphs be either visi- ble or invisible, as you prefer. At any time, as a Standard Action, you may Channel any Glyph youhave set down. This causes the Glyph's eye to open and become visi- ble if it was not. While you are channeling a Glyph, you are able to see through the Glyph, listen through it, and project your voice through it.

Glitch Shuffle.title: Glitch Shuffle

fields.value: Glitch Bender, Expert Perception, Occult Education, or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Glitch Shuffle.description: You learn the Moves Metronome and Topsy- Turvy

Glitch Burst.title: Glitch Burst

fields.value: Glitch Shuffle, Master Perception, Occult Education, or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit with Topsy-Turvy or use another Glitch Bender Move
fields.name: Trigger

Glitch Burst.description:
Glitch Burst's effect depends on the triggering Move.
»Disable
»Snatch
»Metronome
»Topsy-Turvy

fields.value: Glitched Existence, Novice Focus, Occult Education, or Perception
fields.name: Prerequisites

Gleeful Steps.title: Gleeful Steps

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Cute-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Gleeful Steps.description: In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.

Glamour Weaver.title: Glamour Weaver

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Fairy), Novice Charm, Novice Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Glamour Weaver.description: You learn the Moves Sweet Kiss and Disarming Voice.

Glamour Mastery.title: Glamour Mastery
Glamour Mastery.description: Choose Magic Guard or Magic Bounce. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Glacial Ice.title: Glacial Ice
Glacial Ice.description: Your Ice-Type Pokémon gain Damage Reduction equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank against Fighting, Fire, Rock, and Steel-Typed Attacks from which they would take Super-Effective Damage.

Glacial Defense.title: Glacial Defense
Glacial Defense.description: Choose Ice Shield or Winter's Kiss. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Giftsapper.title: Giftsapper
Giftsapper.description: As long as Giftsapper’s user is conscious, all Trainers within 10 meters must make a Focus Check with DC equal to three times the highest Skill Rank of Giftsaper's user between Focus, Intimidate, or Command in order to activate their Gifts. This Check is made each time a Trainer attempts to use an activated Gift, and a failure means neither any resources such as AP nor the frequency of the Gift is expended. For Gifts with Static or ongoing effects, the Check is made each turn, and a failure ends the effect for that turn. Giftsapper’s user may never gain Gifts.

Gift of Power.title: Gift of Power
Gift of Power.description: You gift your target with a Blessing of your own. Whether this makes them Touched, a Signer, or Branded is at your digression. The actual Blessings may not need be the one listed here for your Legendary Form, but ones of your own creation at your GM’s discretion.

fields.value: One Major Gift from Your Patron Legendary
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You sense the presence of and can identify those with Gifts coming from your patron’s subservient Pokémon. You know which Gifts someone has from your patron’s subservient Pokémon by looking at them.
fields.name: Static Effect

fields.value: Target Trainer within 8 meters with a Gift from your patron’s subservient Pokémon has the Gift of your choice from that subservient Pokémon disabled for the next ten minutes.
fields.name: 2 AP Effect

Ghost Step.title: Ghost Step
Ghost Step.description: Your Ghost-Type Pokémon may activate this Feature by spending a Shift Action to remove themselves from the field. They may not be targeted in any way during this time. At the beginning of their next turn, they reappear in any square of their choice that they could have Shifted to from their previous location. Each Pokémon may activate Ghost Step only once per Scene.

Genjutsu.title: Genjutsu
Genjutsu.description: You form an Illusion around yourself. This Illusion may be used to hide yourself in a shroud of darkness if in darkness, or to make yourself look like a mundane object (such as a crate, potted plant, or similar). The Illusion can even fool Aura, concealing you from Aura Sight for its duration. However, the Illusion requires complete concentration, and is broken if you take any actions at all. Anyone that interacts with the Illusion directly may make an Occult Education or Intuition Check with a DC equal to 10 plus your Stealth Rank; if they succeed, the Illusion is broken.

Genetic Memory.title: Genetic Memory

fields.value: Your Fossil Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
fields.name: Target

Genetic Memory.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns any Move from its Egg Move or Tutor Move List. Genetic Memory may target a Pokémon only twice: once with a Tutor Move and once with an Egg Move. Egg Moves tutored this way do not count against the limit of 3 for TM and Tutor Moves.

Gale Strike.title: Gale Strike

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Flying-Type Move with an Accuracy Check
fields.name: Trigger

Gale Strike.description: You may roll the Accuracy Check twice, and resolve using either result. If both results would hit and you resolve the attack using the lower result, Gale Strike's Frequency is not expended.

Gale Speed.title: Gale Speed

fields.value: Raging Winds Rank 1, Master Acrobatics or Perception
fields.name: Prerequisites

Gale Speed.description: Choose Celebrate or Gale Wings. You gain the chosen Ability.

Fusion Cases.title: Fusion Cases
Fusion Cases.description: You combine two different Poké Ball Cases into a single Fusion Case with both effects and types. Fusion Cases may not be used as Ingredients for this Feature.

Frozen Domain.title: Frozen Domain

fields.value: Frost Touched, Expert Athletics or Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Frozen Domain.description: Set 6 square meters of Frozen Domain within range 6. All 6 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of Frozen Domain. All legal targets passing through these squares must make an Acrobatics check with a DC equal to 4 + twice your Survival Rank. On failure, the target is Tripped. Pokémon who are flying, levitating, or have the Naturewalk (Tundra) Capability are immune to this effect. When standing on a square affected by Frozen Domain, you may act as if you were in Hail weather. When a Fire-Type attack originates from or targets a square of Frozen Domain, that square of Frozen Domain melts and is cleared. Frozen Domain is considered a Hazard.

Frost Touched.title: Frost Touched

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Ice), Novice Athletics, Novice Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Frost Touched.description: Choose two out of Haze, Ice Shard, Mist, and Powder Snow. You learn the Chosen Moves.

Front Line Healer.title: Front Line Healer
Front Line Healer.description: When you apply a Restorative, you gain +5 Damage Reduction for 1 full round. Whenever you use Combat Medic's Primer's Rank 2 effect, you may apply the same effect on yourself. Damage Reduction from this Feature does not stack with itself.

Frenzy.title: Frenzy

fields.value: You must currently be Enraged to use this Feature Effect
fields.name: Trigger

Frenzy.description: You may immediately take your turn with Priority. If you do, you are instantly cured of Slowed and Stuck, and for the rest of this turn gain a +2 Bonus to Critical Hit Range, +2 Bonus to Movement Speed, and +2 Bonus to Acrobatics, Athletics, Combat, and Intimidate Checks.

Fountain of Life.title: Fountain of Life

fields.value: Your Water-Type Pokémon hits with a damaging Water-Type attack
fields.name: Trigger

Fountain of Life.description: You may choose to take a penalty to the Damage Roll for the attack up to triple your Type-Linked Skill Rank or up to half the rolled damage for the triggering attack, whichever is lower. Your Pokémon gains twice that value in Temporary Hit Points and may cure themselves of one Status Affliction. Fountain of Life may only be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Fossil Restoration.title: Fossil Restoration

fields.value: Paleontology Research Field, Paleontologist, Novice Pokémon Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Fossil Restoration.description: The resulting Pokémon is born with 2 fewer Tutor Points, and gains its second Basic Ability. If it has only has one Basic Ability, it gains one of its Advanced Abilities, chosen by the GM. This Feature does not affect how the Pokémon continues to gain Abilities.

Fortress.title: Fortress

fields.value: You target an enemy with a Struggle attack or Weapon Attack and end your turn adjacent to the target.
fields.name: Target

Fortress.description: You Mark all targets of the attack until the end of your next turn. Marked foes take a penalty to Attack Rolls against any targets besides you equal to your Focus Rank. A Mark from a different source (such as a second Fortress or a Fighting Type Ace's Pokémon) will overwrite your Mark.

Forest Ranger.title: Forest Ranger – Forest Terrain
Forest Ranger.description: You’re used to navigating the dense plant life of large forests. You gain the Stealth Capability.

Force of Will.title: Force of Will

fields.value: Psionic Sponge, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Psychic-Type Status Move with a range of Blessing, Field, Hazard, or Self.
fields.name: Trigger

Force of Will.description: Your Pokémon may immediately use another Psychic-Type Status Move from its Move List with a range of Blessing, Field, Hazard, or Self.

Foiling Foliage.title: Foiling Foliage

fields.value: Your Pokémon with a Grass-Type Status Move
fields.name: Target

Foiling Foliage.description: Pick a Grass-Type Status-Class Move known by the target. The chosen Move no longer takes up a Move Slot. A Pokémon may have only one Move bypass the Move Limit at a time; if a new Move is chosen for a Pokémon, the previous Move loses this effect.

Focused Training.title: Focused Training
Focused Training.description: The target becomes Focused until the end of the effect duration. Focused Pokémon gain a +1 bonus to Accuracy Rolls and +2 to Skill Checks.

Focused Command.title: Focused Command

fields.value: Master Command, one of Focus, Guile, Intimidate, or Pokémon Education at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Focused Command.description: You may have a second Pokémon take a turn this round, but both Pokémon can only take At-Will actions that round. Additionally, both Pokémon receive a -5 Penalty on all Damage Rolls. You may pay 1 AP at the beginning of the round to lift the Frequency Restriction OR the Damage Penalty for the remainder of the round, or pay 2 AP to lift both.

Flourish.title: Flourish
Flourish.description:
Your Pokémon's Status-Class Moves that affect foes ignore non-Stat Evasion. They may Critically Hit like damaging Moves on a roll of 20. Upon such a Critical Hit, choose one effect from the list below. This Critical Hit rate may be modified as normal.
» If the Move inflicts a Status Affliction with a Save Check, all affected targets get a -4 penalty to their first Save Check.
» If the Move lowers Combat Stages, then pick a Stat that the Move lowers and lower it by 1 additional Combat Stage.
» Your Pokémon gains a Tick of Temporary Hit Points.

Flood!.title: Flood!
Flood!.description: Your Water-Type Pokemon may activate Flood! as a Shift Action to use a damaging Water-Type Move as if had a range of Line 4 or Close Blast 2 instead of its usual range.

Flip Out.title: Flip Out
Flip Out.description:
Your Tumbler Moves gain additional effects.
» Aerial Ace
» Splash
» Acrobatics
» Bounce

Flight.title: Flight

fields.value: One With the Winds, Adept Acrobatics
fields.name: Prerequisites

Flight.description: You gain a Sky Speed equal to your Levitate Speed plus your Acrobatics or Perception Rank for the remainder of the round.

Flexible Preparations.title: Flexible Preparations

fields.value: Adaptable Performance, Adept Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A Pokémon that has Contest Stats from Poffins
fields.name: Target

Flexible Preparations.description: The target may reallocate up to 2d6 of Poffin-Derived Contest Stats from one Contest Stat to another. This effect lasts until the end of the day.

Flexible Form.title: Flexible Form
Flexible Form.description: Your body becomes more malleable, and even your bones are able to flex when required. You do not gain Injuries from taking Massive damage, and you gain a +2 Bonus to any Acrobatics or Athletics Check made to bend, squeeze, or otherwise contort your body -in- cluding those to avoid Trip or Grapple maneuvers.

Fistful of Force.title: Fistful of Force

fields.value: You must have a Shard in your Main Hand or Off-Hand to use Fistful of Force.
fields.name: Trigger

Fistful of Force.description: You may destroy the Shard to use the Move Judgment. Judgment's Type must be one of the Types associated with the used Shard. Instead of adding your Special Attack when using this attack, you may choose to add your Occult Education Rank tripled.

Fishbowl Technique.title: Fishbowl Technique
Fishbowl Technique.description: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Rainy Weather.

First Blood.title: First Blood

fields.value: Tag In, Master Acrobatics or Guile
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You release a Pokémon from its Poké Ball
fields.name: Trigger
