First Blood.description: If you have a Pokémon turn available this round or next, your Pokémon may use a Move as an Interrupt as soon as it is sent out. This consumes your Pokémon turn for the round (or the following round) as normal.

First Aid Expertise.title: First Aid Expertise
First Aid Expertise.description: The target may remove one Injury, has all Hit Points restored, and is cured of all Status Afflictions. You may use First Aid Expertise only once per day per target. First Aid Expertise requires access to a First Aid Kit.

Firebrand.title: Firebrand

fields.value: Fire Bringer, Adept Focus or Combat
fields.name: Prerequisites

Firebrand.description: Your Fire-Type Moves Burn Targets on a roll of 19+. If a move already has a chance of Burning foes, Firebrand increases the effect range by +2.

Fire Bringer.title: Fire Bringer
Fire Bringer.description: Choose two of Flame Burst, Flame Wheel, Flame Charge, or Will-O-Wisp. You learn the chosen Moves

Fire Breather.title: Fire Breather

fields.value: Fire Bringer, Expert Focus or Combat
fields.name: Rank 1 Prerequisites

Fire Breather.description: Learn two Fire Bringer Moves from the list below. You may choose any Move marked with the Fire Breather Rank you are taking or lower.

Finisher.title: Finisher
Finisher.description: You and your Pokémon gain a +5 bonus to Damage Rolls against Fainted, Flinched, Sleeping, Stuck, Slowed, Trapped, or Tripped targets.

Fighter's Versatility.title: Fighter's Versatility

fields.value: Learned two Scene or Daily Moves
fields.name: Prerequisites

Fighter's Versatility.description: You may give up use of a Scene or Daily Move to regain use of a Scene or Daily Move which you have already used. You may give up use of a Daily Move to regain use of a Scene Move, but not vice-versa.

Fight On and On.title: Fight On and On

fields.value: Lessons in Rage and Pain, Adept Combat
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Hit Points are lowered to or below 0 while Enraged.
fields.name: Trigger

Fight On and On.description: You are not Fainted; you instead Faint upon reaching -50% of your Max Hit Points. If you have 5 or more injuries, you may use this Feature regardless of Frequency.

Fiery Soul.title: Fiery Soul
Fiery Soul.description: You gain the Heater Capability, and are immune to the Burn condition.

Fey Trance.title: Fey Trance

fields.value: Fairy Lights, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Fey Trance.description: While this Feature is bound, whenever the target uses a 1-Target Move with the Social Keyword or a Fairy-Type Status Move, the foe hit by the triggering Move becomes Infatuated with your Pokemon, and immediately Shifts towards your Pokemon, forfeiting their next Shift Action. This may affect a specific foe only once per Scene.

Fey Law.title: Fey Law

fields.value: You hit a foe with a damaging Fairy attack
fields.name: Frequency

Fey Law.description: Choose one of the following: Status-Class, Combat Maneuver, attacks with an unmodified Damage Base 10 or higher, or an Elemental Type. The triggering foe is Bound; they suffer a -X penalty to all rolls made to use attacks with the chosen trait. X is equal to half your Charm or Occult Education Rank. The Bound condition lasts until the end of a Scene. You may unbind someone as a Free Action at any time. A target may not have multiple instances of Bound applied at once.

Fearsome Display.title: Fearsome Display

fields.value: You use Leer or a Roughneck Move
fields.name: Trigger

Fearsome Display.description:
The Move gains additional effects.
» Leer
» Chip Away
» Headbutt
» Glare
» Mean Look
» Endure
» Slack Off

Fashionista.title: Fashionista

fields.value: Two of Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition at Novice
fields.name: Prerequisites

Fashionista.description: You may craft any Fashionista Recipe for which you qualify.

Farcast.title: Farcast

fields.value: You use the Move Teleport or activate the Teleporter Capability
fields.name: Trigger

Farcast.description: Choose One: You activate Teleporter as if your Teleporter value were three times its normal value or you may take one willing Pokémon or Trainer along with you as you teleport so long as you are touching them when you activate Farcast. You may expend two uses of Farcast at once to choose both effects.

Fan The Flames.title: Fan The Flames

fields.value: Brightest Flame, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a 1-Target Fire-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Fan The Flames.description: Instead of its usual range, the attack may be performed as if it had a range of Burst 1 if melee, or Cone 2 if ranged.

Fairy Rite.title: Fairy Rite

fields.value: Fairy Lights, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon creates Fairy Lights as a Standard Action
fields.name: Trigger

Fairy Rite.description: Your Fairy-Type Pokémon may activate Fairy Rite as a Standard Action to lose any number of Hit Points, up to a maximum equal to your Pokémon's Level, and heal an adjacent Ally by that many Hit Points. Then, if your Fairy-Type Pokémon has any Fairy Lights, they may immediately expend any Fairy Lights to gain a Tick of Hit Points, or cause an ally within 6 meters to gain a Tick of Hit Points.

Fairy Lights.title: Fairy Lights

fields.value: Fairy Lights also provide mild lighting, comparable to a candle. As an extended action your Pokemon can control the lights individually, but they must stay within 6 meters of the Pokemon that created them.
fields.name: Special

Fairy Lights.description: Your Fairy-Type Pokemon may activate Fairy Lights as a Standard Action to create 3 Fairy Lights that hover around themselves. Whenever the target is attacked by a foe within 6 meters, they may expend a Fairy Light to either immediately gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points, or to use the Move Fairy Wind as a Free Action.

Face Me Whelp.title: Face Me Whelp

fields.value: Close Quarters Mastery, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Face Me Whelp.description: While your Pokémon is adjacent to a foe they Marked, that foe gains a -X penalty to Accuracy Rolls and a -10 penalty to Damage Rolls on attacks that do not target the Pokémon that Marked them. X is equal to half your Type-Linked Skill Rank.

Fabulous Max.title: Fabulous Max

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Beauty-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value: The move gains the keyword Burst 1 if Melee, or Blast 2 if ranged. If the move is already a Burst, Blast, or Cone, increase the size of the Move's Range by 1. This does not cause a target to be hit multiple times. You may activate Fabulous Max only once per Pokémon per Scene.
fields.name: In Battles

Fabulous Max.description: In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.

Extreme Weather.title: Extreme Weather

fields.value: You or your Pokémon create a Weather Condition
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value: All Trainers and Pokémon that take Hail Damage take a -5 Penalty to all Damage Rolls.
fields.name: »» Hail

fields.value: All Trainers and Pokémon that are not Water or Grass typed are Slowed.
fields.name: »» Rain

fields.value: All Trainers and Pokémon that take Sandstorm damage take a -2 Penalty to Accuracy Rolls.
fields.name: »» Sandstorm

fields.value: Trainers and Pokémon that are not Fire or Grass Typed are Suppressed.
fields.name: »» Sun

Extreme Weather.description: The Weather is particularly intense and has additional effects.

Extra Ordinary.title: Extra Ordinary

fields.value: Your Normal-Type Pokémon with Last Chance or Normal Strategist
fields.name: Target

Extra Ordinary.description: Your Pokémon gains the Last Chance or Normal Strategist Ability, whichever one they do not already have. Extra Ordinary can target a Pokémon only once.

Explosive Runes.title: Explosive Runes

fields.value: Adept Occult Education, Glyph, Hidden Power
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: A Glyph you have put down, regardless of distance
fields.name: Target

Explosive Runes.description: You may use Hidden Power, originating the attack from the location of the targeted Glyph. Use your own Stats and Hidden Power values to calculate damage. Using this Feature causes the Glyph to become visible and glow for a minute afterwards.

Experimental Designs.title: Experimental Designs

fields.value: You or your Pokémon with Augmentations
fields.name: Target

Experimental Designs.description:
Choose an Augmentation the target has and apply the upgrade below. Experimental Designs may affect a target twice.
»Enhanced Sight
»Smart Vision
»Synthetic Muscle
»Embedded Weaponry
»Wired Reflexes
»Medical Nanobots
»Dermal Plating
»Thermal-Optic Camo

Experimental AI.title: Experimental AI
Experimental AI.description: Increase the maximum complexity of all Pokébots you create by 2, and increase the maximum complexity of Pokébots you can control by 2.

Expend Momentum.title: Expend Momentum

fields.value: Your Pokémon under the effects of Focused Training
fields.name: Target

Expend Momentum.description:
Apply one of the following effects on the target by spending that much Momentum.
» Spend 1 Momentum
» Spend 2 Momentum
» Spend 3 Momentum

Expand Horizons.title: Expand Horizons
Expand Horizons.description: Your Pokémon gains 3 Tutor Points. A Pokémon may be targeted by Expand Horizons only once.

Equipment Savant.title: Equipment Savant
Equipment Savant.description: Use or Equip an Item or piece of Equipment which would normally require a Standard Action to use or equip. You may not make an Attack with a Weapon this way - using other Items or Equipment that requires "Attacks" (such as Cap Cannons or Poké Balls) is acceptable.

Enticing Beauty.title: Enticing Beauty
Enticing Beauty.description: The target acts as a Bait item as if it had the Alluring Capability. Add its number of Beauty Dice from Poffins as a Bonus to all d20 lure rolls.

Enhanced Embrace.title: Enhanced Embrace
Enhanced Embrace.description: Learn two Moves from the list below at the Rank of Enhanced Embrace you are taking or lower. Moves marked with an Embrace require that Embrace to be chosen.

Enhanced Capsules.title: Enhanced Capsules

fields.value: A willing Pokémon with one of the Capabilities listed below
fields.name: Target

Enhanced Capsules.description:
Choose one of the Capabilities below which the target Pokémon has. You create a consumable item with the effect below, depending on the chosen Capability. All unused items created with Enhanced Capsules are rendered inert after an Extended Rest (including modifications to other items).
»Glow
»Magnetic
»Threaded
»Zapper

Engineer.title: Engineer
Engineer.description: You may craft any Engineer Recipe for which you qualify.

Enduring Soul.title: Enduring Soul
Enduring Soul.description: You may add to your Pokémon's HP stat when they level up, ignoring Base Relation, and you do not need to "correct" Stats due to this inflated HP.

Enduring Bloom.title: Enduring Bloom

fields.value: Foiling Foliage, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Grass-Type Pokémon is hit by a damaging Bug, Fire, Flying, Ice, or Poison attack that deals Super- Effective Damage
fields.name: Trigger

Enduring Bloom.description: Your Pokémon gains Temporary Hit Points equal to twice your Type-Linked Skill Rank, and gains +1 Combat Stage in the Stat of your choice. If it is Sunny, they may gain +1 Combat Stage in a second, different Stat. You may activate Enduring Bloom only once per Scene per Pokémon.

Endurance.title: Endurance

fields.value: Your Pokémon takes falling damage, begins to suffocate, or is Heavily Injured.
fields.name: Trigger

Endurance.description: Your Pokémon can ignore up to X meters of falling when calculating falling damage, act without beginning to suffocate for X additional rounds, or ignore the Hit Point loss effects from acting while Heavily Injured for X rounds. X is equal to half its number of Tough Dice from Poffins.

Encore Performance.title: Encore Performance

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Status-Class Move that does not target foes.
fields.name: Trigger

Encore Performance.description: Choose One: Your Pokémon gains +1 Combat Stage in any Stat in which they haven't gained a Combat Stage this turn; or gains a second Standard Action this round that must be used to make an At-Will action that does not trigger Encore Peformance; or, if they are placing Hazards, they may place an additional two units; or, if they are activating a Weather Effect, it lasts an additional two turns; or, if they are activating a Blessing, it gains an additional use.

Enchanting Transformation.title: Enchanting Transformation
Enchanting Transformation.description:
You perform a magical transformation on yourself. While this Feature is Bound, you gain +5 Damage Resistance against Dragon, Fighting, Dark, and Bug-Typed attacks and your Glamour Weaver Moves have the additional effects below.
» Sweet Kiss
» Dazzling Gleam
» Draining Kiss
» Moonblast
» Aromatic Mist

Enchanting Gaze.title: Enchanting Gaze

fields.value: Quick Wit, two Provocateur Skills at Expert Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

Enchanting Gaze.description: Choose a Manipulate Maneuver effect; apply that Effect to all foes in a Cone 2. This ignores Frequency Limitations with that Maneuver and automatically succeeds against all targets without an opposed roll.

Emergency Release.title: Emergency Release
Emergency Release.description: The next Pokémon you send out is treated as if the recalled Pokémon had used Baton Pass on it.

Emergency Reactivation.title: Emergency Reactivation

fields.value: You or your Pokémon suffer Augmentation Shock
fields.name: Trigger

Emergency Reactivation.description: The triggering user does not suffer Augmenta- tion Shock and their Augmentations are not disabled. This Feature may affect a target only once per Scene.

Elite Trainer.title: Elite Trainer
Elite Trainer.description: Choose Agility Training, Brutal Training, Focused Training, or Inspired Training. You gain the chosen Feature, even if you do not meet the prerequisites. When training, you may apply up to two different [Training] Features on each of your Pokémon. If you already have all of these Features, instead pick another Feature for which you qualify.

Egg Tutor.title: Egg Tutor

fields.value: A Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points.
fields.name: Target

Egg Tutor.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points, and learns any Move from its Egg Move List. A Pokémon may be targeted by Egg Tutor only one time.

Efficient Installation.title: Efficient Installation
Efficient Installation.description: You and your Pokémon gain a +2 boost to their maximum Augmentation Capacity and count their used Capacity as 2 lower for the purposes of Augmentation Shock. You and your Pokémon can install multiple Augmentations in the same Slot.

Effective Methods.title: Effective Methods

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
fields.name: Target

Effective Methods.description: Your Pokémon loses 2 Tutor Points and gains your choice of the Exploit or Tolerance Ability. You may only target a Pokémon once with Effective Methods.

Echoes of the Future.title: Echoes of the Future

fields.value: Breadth of Knowledge, Master General Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You or your Pokémon make a roll
fields.name: Trigger

Echoes of the Future.description: You may roll twice and keep the best result.

Earthshifter.title: Earthshifter

fields.value: You hit with a damaging Ground Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Earthshifter.description: You initiate a Trip Maneuver against 1 target of the Move. The Maneuver automatically hits, and you may use your Focus or Intuition for the opposed check

Earthroil.title: Earthroil

fields.value: Mold the Earth, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Earthroil.description: Your Ground-Type Pokémon may activate Earthroil as a Shift Action to use a damaging Ground- Type Move as it had a range of Line 4 or Burst 1 instead of its usual range, and as if it had the Groundsource keyword. 1-Target Moves performed this way take a -5 penalty to their Damage Rolls.

Earthen Bond.title: Earthen Bond
Earthen Bond.description: You gain the Tremorsense Capability, and you gain Naturewalk for Cave, Mountain and Desert.

Earth Shaker.title: Earth Shaker

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Ground), Novice Intuition, Novice Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Earth Shaker.description: Pick two of Bulldoze, Mud Shot, or Sand-Attack. You learn the chosen Moves.

Earth Mother's Blessing.title: Earth Mother's Blessing

fields.value: Earth Shaker, Adept Focus or Intuition
fields.name: Rank 1 Prerequisites

fields.value: Ground Out, Master Focus or Intuition
fields.name: Rank 2 Prerequisites

Earth Mother's Blessing.description: Each Rank, choose Arena Trap or Lightning Rod. You gain the chosen Ability.

Dune Walker.title: Dune Walker – Desert Terrain
Dune Walker.description: Your long hours in the unforgiving desert have made you inured to sand and heat. You’re immune to the effects of Sandstorm, Sand-Attack, and Sand Tomb, and you gain 5 Damage Reduction against Fire-Type attacks.

Dumplings.title: Dumplings

fields.value: You mix the two ingredients into one Snack that has the same effect as its ingredients. The two ingredients must be different items.
fields.name: Effect

Dumplings.description: Ingredient 1: Leftovers, Preserves, or a Snack made with Chef

Duelist's Manual.title: Duelist's Manual

fields.value: Expend Momentum, Effective Methods, Expert Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon under the effects of Focused Training
fields.name: Target

Duelist's Manual.description:
Apply one of the following effects. To choose an effect, your Pokémon must have a certain amount of Momentum. (Duelist's Manual does not spend Momentum).
» 1 Momentum
» 2 Momentum
» 3 Momentum

Duelist.title: Duelist

fields.value:
» Your Pokémon begins each Scene with 0 Momentum.
» At the end of each Combat round, your Pokémon gains +1 Momentum.
» Whenever your Pokémon hits a Tagged foe, they gain +1 Momentum.
» Your Pokémon has a maximum of 6 Momentum. So use a d6 to track it.
» All Momentum is lost when your Pokémon Faints, your Pokémon is recalled, or combat ends.
fields.name: Mechanic – Momentum

Duelist.description:
The Foe becomes Tagged; or if the foe is already Tagged, the foe loses the Tag. Only one foe can be Tagged this way at a time. If a new Foe is Tagged, all other Tags are lost.
Your Pokémon under the effects of Focused Training gain half their Momentum (rounded up) as a Bonus to Accuracy and Evasion against Tagged Foes, but as long as a Foe is Tagged, they do not benefit from Focused Training's Accuracy Bonus against other foes.

Druid's Call.title: Druid's Call
Druid's Call.description: 6 small saplings, flowery bushes, or mushroom patches (depending on your oath) suddenly grow within 6 meters of you, occupying 1 square each. This veg- etation lasts until the end of the encounter, and acts as rough terrain that blocks line of sight for Pokémon and Trainers without the Naturewalk (Forest) Capability. Whenever you use a Move learned through Nature's Embrace, you may have it originate from these Plants as if they were the user. This Feature must be used on soil, or terrain under which soil is hidden by only a few inches (such as most sidewalks, parking lots, gravel or woodchip lots, etc.)

Druid.title: Druid

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Grass), Novice Survival, Novice General Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Druid.description: Your powers begin to take after either Flowers, Fungi, or Trees. Depending on your oath, you gain an Ability and Stat Tags. Whenever you gain a Druid Feature, you gain the same Stat Tags.

Dress to Impress.title: Dress to Impress

fields.value: Versatile Wardrobe, two Fashionista Skills at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

Dress to Impress.description: Whenever you create an Incense Held Item, choose Sweet Scent or Aromatic Mist. While your Pokémon is holding that Incense Item in an active Held Item slot, they add the chosen Move to their Move List.

Double Shot.title: Double Shot
Double Shot.description: You may make two Struggle Attacks with a -2 penalty to Accuracy, each targeting the same foe. If the first attack gains the benefit of Aiming Down the Sights or Clear Shot, the second attack also gains the same benefits for free.

Don't Look Away.title: Don't Look Away

fields.value: Pack Tactics, Adept Stealth, Adept Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You or your Pokémon with Pack Hunt or Teamwork hits with an Attack of Opportunity
fields.name: Trigger

Don't Look Away.description: The hit foe loses a Tick of Hit Points, and is Slowed for 1 round. Don't Look Away may be triggered once per round.

Divine Wind.title: Divine Wind

fields.value: Blessings you generated with a Sage Move
fields.name: Target

Divine Wind.description: Choose a type of Blessing you can generate with a Sage Move. All Blessings you generated of another type become Blessings of the chosen type. This may not be used to generate more uses of a Blessing than the original Move creates. For example, three Lucky Chant Blessings would become two Reflect or Light Screen Blessings, not three. You may only choose a Blessing type once per Scene.

Divination.title: Divination
Divination.description: You may perform an Augury or Scrying.

Dive (Feature).title: Dive (Feature)

fields.value: You are targeted by a Ranged 1-Target Attack, or are in a Cone, Burst, Blast, or Line.
fields.name: Trigger

Dive (Feature).description: You may immediately Shift 1 Meter, and then become Tripped. This Feature cannot be used if you are Stuck, Grappled, or otherwise impaired from Shifting. This Feature causes you to dodge Ranged attacks aimed at you, and may let you avoid Cones, Bursts, Blasts, or Lines if the shift removes you from the area of effect.

Disruption Order.title: Disruption Order

fields.value: Insectoid Utility, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a Bug-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Disruption Order.description: Until the end of user's next turn, all targets hit by the Move are Slowed, suffer a -X to Accuracy Rolls, and are Flinched by Damaging Attacks on 16+.

Dirty Fighting.title: Dirty Fighting

fields.value: Rogue, a Rogue Skill at Adept Rank
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You hit a foe with Weapon Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Dirty Fighting.description: After the attack is Resolved, you may immediately use the Dirty Trick Maneuver if the target is within range. You automatically hit with Dirty Trick, but must still make an Opposed Roll.

Directed Focus.title: Directed Focus
Directed Focus.description: Whenever your Pokémon with the Exploit or Tolerance Ability are targeted by an [Order], deal Super- Effective Damage, or take Super-Effective Damage, they gain +1 Momentum after all effects of the Move or Order are resolved.

Dilettante.title: Dilettante
Dilettante.description: Each Rank of Dilettante, you gain both an Edge and a General Feature from the lists below. You may gain the chosen Edge and Feature even if you do not meet the Skill prerequisites. You must meet any other Prerequisites. Whenever you gain a Feature or Edge this way, change any Skill Rank applications or Skill Checks mandated directly by the Edge or Feature into your choice of General Education or Perception Skill Checks or Rank applications instead.

Diffuse Pain.title: Diffuse Pain

fields.value: You use a Status-Class Move gained from Hex Maniac Studies
fields.name: Trigger

Diffuse Pain.description: Choose an additional target for the Move.

Dietician.title: Dietician
Dietician.description: Your Pokemon can benefit from a maximum of 7 Vitamins.

Devious.title: Devious

fields.value: Clever Ruse, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Dark-Type Pokémon uses a Move with the Social keyword.
fields.name: Trigger

Devious.description: Your Pokémon may immediately use a naturally Dark-Typed Status-Class Move or a Move with the Social keyword as a Free Action. This must be a different Move than the triggering Move, and must follow all Frequency limitations. Devious may be used only once per Scene per Pokémon.

Desperate Strike.title: Desperate Strike

fields.value: Your Pokémon triggers Cruelty, or scores a Critical Hit with damaging attack.
fields.name: Trigger

Desperate Strike.description: Your Pokemon may apply the effects of Cruelty to the attack without expending Cruelty's Frequency. Cruelty's effects may be purchased as if the foe had additional injuries equal to the number of injuries on the user. Desperate Strike may be used once per Scene per Pokémon.

Desert Heart.title: Desert Heart

fields.value: Mold the Earth, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Desert Heart.description: While this Stratagem is bound, your Pokémon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in a Sandstorm.

Defender.title: Defender
Defender.description: Using the Intercept Maneuvers requires only a Shift Action Interrupt.

Deep Diver.title: Deep Diver – Ocean Terrain
Deep Diver.description: You love nothing better than the smell of the sea. Your Swimming Capability is equal to your Overland Capability instead of half. Additionally, you may hold your breath underwater for a number of minutes equal to your Survival Rank before you start suffocating.

Deep Cold.title: Deep Cold

fields.value: Glacial Ice, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Ice-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Deep Cold.description: The target is Frozen, and has their Attack, Special Attack, and Speed Combat Stages lowered by 1 each. The target is automatically cured of the Frozen Condition after 1 full round. A foe may be affected by Deep Cold only once per Scene.

Decisive Director.title: Decisive Director
Decisive Director.description: Add or subtract X from the target's Initiative until the end of your next turn. X is equal to your Charm Rank doubled.

Debilitate.title: Debilitate

fields.value: Potent Venom, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Debilitate.description: While this Feature is Bound, when the target sucessfully hits a Poisoned or Blighted foe with a Poison- Type Move, the foe gains a -2 penalty to Accuracy Rolls and Evasion for one full round.

Death From Above.title: Death From Above
Death From Above.description: You learn the Moves Acrobatics and Bounce.

Deadly Gambit.title: Deadly Gambit

fields.value: Your Pokémon is the target of a foe's damaging melee attack
fields.name: Trigger

Deadly Gambit.description: The triggering attack automatically hits as if it was a Critical Hit. Before damage resolves, your Pokémon may use a 1-Target damaging attack on the foe making the triggering attack as an Interrupt, Frequency allowing, and also automatically hits as a Critical Hit. Damage for both attacks then resolve at the same time.

Dead-Eye Shot.title: Dead-Eye Shot
Dead-Eye Shot.description: Use of Dead-Eye Shot must be declared at the start of the round. Nothings happens at this time. At the end of the round, the user may use their Shift Action, and then make a Ranged Weapon Attack and roll twice for Accuracy. You may resolve the attack using either result, but if you choose to use the lower result and the attack hits, it is automatically a Critical Hit.

Dazzling Dervish.title: Dazzling Dervish
Dazzling Dervish.description: Until the end of their next turn, the target adds their non-stat Evasion to their Movement Capabilities and whenever they attack a foe or Shift through a square occupied by a foe, that foe suffers a -3 penalty to all rolls until the end of their next turn. This effect may only affect a foe once per round.

Dashing Makeover.title: Dashing Makeover
Dashing Makeover.description: When you activate Dashing Makeover, choose one Equipment or Held Item you can create. While this Feature is Bound, the target gains the effects of the chosen item, as long as they would normally be able to equip it (ex: Trainers cannot equip Incense Items).They do not need to take up an Equipment or Held Item slot to gain this benefit. A target may only be affected by one instance of Dashing Makeover at a time.

Dark Soul.title: Dark Soul

fields.value: Shade Caller, Master Guile or Stealth
fields.name: Prerequisites

Dark Soul.description: Choose Shadow Tag or Super Luck. You gain the chosen Ability.

Dancer (Feature).title: Dancer (Feature)

fields.value: Novice Acrobatics; Novice Athletics or Charm
fields.name: Prerequisites

Dancer (Feature).description: Choose Spinning Dance or Own Tempo. You gain the chosen Ability.

Dance Practice.title: Dance Practice

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
fields.name: Target

Dance Practice.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and gains your choice of Spinning Dance or Own Tempo. Dance Practice may target a Pokémon only once.

Dance Form.title: Dance Form

fields.value: Dance Moves you create with the Dance Form Feature look like the Move on the right. First, name the Dance Move whatever you like. Secondly, choose two Combat Stage gains for the effect. This may either be +2 Combat Stages to a single Stat, like Swords Dance, or +1 Combat Stage to two different Stats, like Dragon Dance. Once chosen, this cannot be changed. Dragon Dance, Quiver Dance, and Swords Dance count as Dance Moves for the purposes of Dancer Features as well. A Dance Move’s Contest Type must be chosen from a Contest Type associated with a Stat that the Dance Move affects. Cool is associated with Attack, Tough is associated with Defense, Beauty is associated with Special Attack, Smart is associated with Special Defense, and Cute is associated with Speed.
fields.name: Mechanic – Dance Moves

Dance Form.description: Create and learn two Dance Moves, plus one more for each other Dancer Feature you have. Whenever you gain another Dancer Feature, create and learn another Dance Move.

Dabbler.title: Dabbler

fields.value: Hobbyist, Expert General Education or Perception
fields.name: Prerequisites

Dabbler.description: At the Level 5, 10, 20, 30, and 40 Character Advancement Level Milestones, if you choose to gain Bonus Stats, you also gain an Edge for which you qualify. If you choose Bonus Edges or Features, you also gain +2 to your choice of Attack or Special Attack. This applies retroactively.

Cutthroat.title: Cutthroat
Cutthroat.description: You may use Rogue Moves as Weapon Moves when wielding Small Melee Weapons or Short Ranged Weapons. If you do, Rogue Moves instead have the same Range as your Weapon. Additionally, you may qualify for Weapon Moves for Small Melee or Short Ranged Weapons and resist Disarm Maneuvers when wielding such Weapons using any Rogue Skill.

Cute Cuddle.title: Cute Cuddle
Cute Cuddle.description: Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Cute Stat from Poffins may activate Cute Cuddle as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Culinary Appreciation.title: Culinary Appreciation

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
fields.name: Target

Culinary Appreciation.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and gains the Gluttony Ability.

Crystal Resonance.title: Crystal Resonance
Crystal Resonance.description: You roll an additional 3d6 when determining how many Shards you find when Dowsing.

Crystal Artificer.title: Crystal Artificer
Crystal Artificer.description: You may use any Crystal Artificer Recipe for which you qualify.

Cruel Gaze.title: Cruel Gaze
Cruel Gaze.description: You learn the Moves Glare and Headbutt.

Cross-Pollinate.title: Cross-Pollinate

fields.value: Foiling Foliage, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Grass-Type Pokémon uses a damaging Grass-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Cross-Pollinate.description: Your Pokémon may immediately use a Grass- Type Status-Class move as a Free Action.

Critical Moment.title: Critical Moment
Critical Moment.description: The bonuses from your Pokemon's [Training] are tripled until the end of your next turn.

Crippling Shot.title: Crippling Shot
Crippling Shot.description: Make a Ranged Struggle Attack attack with a -2 penalty to Accuracy. If you hit, the attack deals Damage as if it was resisted one step, but the target becomes Slowed, loses 1 Speed Combat Stage, and you initiate a Trip Maneuver against the target. You may use your Perception Skill to resolve the Opposed Check if you wish.

Crash and Smash.title: Crash and Smash
Crash and Smash.description: You learn the Moves Double Edge and Thrash. You may use these moves as a Weapon Attack when wielding Melee Weapons.

Counter Stance.title: Counter Stance

fields.value: An adjacent foe misses you with an attack
fields.name: Trigger

Counter Stance.description: You perform an Attack of Opportunity against them.

Corrupt Reality.title: Corrupt Reality

fields.value: Glitch Bender, Adept Perception, Occult Education, or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Any roll made by a foe
fields.name: Target

Corrupt Reality.description: You may force the foe to reroll that roll.

Corrupt Blood.title: Corrupt Blood
Corrupt Blood.description: You are immune to the Poisoned and Badly Poisoned statuses and resist Poison-type attacks one step further.

Corrosive Blight.title: Corrosive Blight

fields.value: Potent Venom, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits a foe with a Poison-Type Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Corrosive Blight.description: The target gains the Blight Condition for one full round. Blighted targets lose a Tick of Hit Points upon being hit by any attack. If the attack is Poison-Typed, the Blight effect's duration is refreshed.

Coordinator.title: Coordinator

fields.value: Grace, Novice Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition
fields.name: Prerequisites

Coordinator.description: Your Pokémon may reroll a single Appeal Roll or Damage Roll. This Feature may be used only once per Contest, and once per Pokémon per Scene.

Cool Conduct.title: Cool Conduct
Cool Conduct.description: Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Cool Stat from Poffins may activate Cool Conduct as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Conqueror's March.title: Conqueror's March

fields.value: Ramming Speed, Adept Acrobatics or Athletics
fields.name: Prerequisites

Conqueror's March.description: This round, if being used as a Mount, the target may use Dash, Burst, Blast, Cone, or Line range Moves with a range of Pass instead of their usual range.

Complex Orders.title: Complex Orders

fields.value: Commander, at least two Features with the [Orders] Tag that have targets
fields.name: Prerequisites

Complex Orders.description: You may choose a different Order to give to each Target. You must pay all AP costs and follow Frequency restrictions for all Orders used in this way.

Complex Aftertaste.title: Complex Aftertaste

fields.value: You or an ally trades in a Digestion Buff from an item with a Taste
fields.name: Trigger

Complex Aftertaste.description: The target gains a Digestion Buff according to the Taste of the Snack granting the Buff. This Digestion Buff matches that of the corresponding basic Tasty Snack recipe.

Commander's Voice.title: Commander's Voice
Commander's Voice.description:
You may give two different [Orders] as a single Standard Action, or you may give one set of [Orders] as a Swift Action.
If this is used to use Focused Command and another [Order] that has targets, the second Order applies to both Pokémon you are commanding that turn. Commander's Voice doesn't allow you to use Focused Command as a Swift Action.

Commander.title: Commander
Commander.description: Choose one of Ravager Orders, Marksman Orders, Trickster Orders, Guardian Orders, or Precision Orders. You gain the chosen Feature, even if you do not meet its prerequisites.

Command Versatility.title: Command Versatility

fields.value: Adept Command, Guile, or Pokémon Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Command Versatility.description: Your Pokémon may give up use of a Scene or Daily Move to regain use of a Scene or Daily Move which it has already used. Your Pokémon may give up use of a Daily Move to regain use of a Scene Move, but not vice-versa. You may use Command Versatility only once per Scene per Pokémon.

Code Injection.title: Code Injection

fields.value: A Pokémon or Trainer within 5 meters
fields.name: Target

Code Injection.description:
You may use any of the Glitches below. They are treated as a Status-Class attack with an AC of 2. You may only use each Glitch once per Scene, and each target may only be affected by Code Injection once per Scene.
»Object Not Found
»Access Denied
»Blue Screen

Coaching.title: Coaching

fields.value: Your Pokémon makes a Combat Maneuver
fields.name: Trigger

fields.value: Your Pokémon makes a Combat Maneuver
fields.name: Trigger

Coaching.description:
Your Pokémon gains a bonus based on the type of Combat maneuver they are making. This Feature may be triggered once per Scene per Pokémon.
» Your Pokémon gains a +1d6 bonus to Opposed Acrobatics, Athletics, Combat, or Stealth Skill Checks. » If your Pokémon was Sprinting, they double their Movement Capabilities instead of increasing by 50%.
» If your Pokémon was making an Attack of Opportunity, they automatically hit.
» You may also activate this Feature to let them Intercept for any Ally regardless of Loyalty, and they automatically succeed on the Skill Check to do so.

Close Quarters Mastery.title: Close Quarters Mastery
Close Quarters Mastery.description:
While this Feature is Bound, the target's Fighting-Type Moves cause foes to become Marked by the target for 1 full round. If the target is a Fighting- Type Pokémon, they may also Mark the Foe for one full round when hitting with a Grapple, Trip, or Push Maneuver.
Marked Foes provoke an attack of Opportunity from the Pokémon that marked them if they Shift out of an adjacent square into a square that is not adjacent, even if they use a Disengage Maneuver. Targets cannot be Marked by more than one Pokémon at a time.

Climate Control.title: Climate Control

fields.value: A Move or Ability creates a Weather Effect while non-standard Weather is already in effect
fields.name: Trigger

Climate Control.description: The triggering Weather Effect does not replace the already extant Weather in effect; both exist simultaneously on the field. If a new Weather effect is placed on the field after the two that are out, both are replaced by the third, unless you activate this Feature again to replace only one.

Clever Ruse.title: Clever Ruse

fields.value: Your Pokémon misses all targets with a Dark- Type attack on their turn
fields.name: Trigger

Clever Ruse.description:
Your Pokémon may apply two of the effects below after the triggering attack is resolved. Your Pokémon may also take a Standard Action to trigger this Feature. This Feature may be triggered only once per round.
» They gain +4 Evasion for one full round.
» Their attacks ignore Evasion from Stats until the end of their next turn.
» They may immediately Disengage as a Free Action.

Clear Shot.title: Clear Shot

fields.value: You make a ranged Weapon Attack against a target with no other combatants or Rough or Blocking Terrain within 2 meters
fields.name: Trigger

Clear Shot.description: The target is considered Vulnerable against this attack, and you increase your Critical Hit range by +4 for this attack.

Cinematic Analysis.title: Cinematic Analysis

fields.value: You may trigger Character Study when you or an ally makes a Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition Check targeting the subject of your Record. Make a Perception Check and substitute the triggering Skill Check with the result.
fields.name: Character Study — Profile Archive

fields.value: Recreation may be triggered as your Pokémon gains Initiative. Select a Record of a Move in your Technique Archive that your Pokémon can learn by Level Up, TM, or Move Tutor. Your Pokémon may perform that Move as if it was on its Move List. You may select a specific Move only once per day.
fields.name: Recreation — Technique Archive

fields.value: You may only use Situational Awareness if you analyze a Record of your current Location. When used this way, you may activate it as an Interrupt. Choose an ally; that ally may take their next action as Priority (Advanced).
fields.name: Situational Awareness — Travel Archive

Cinematic Analysis.description: You analyze a Record in one of your Archives. Cinematic Analysis's effect depends on the Archive the Record is in. Each of these effects may only be used once per Scene.

Chronicler.title: Chronicler

fields.value: A Pokémon, Trainer, Move, or Location.
fields.name: Target

Chronicler.description:
You make Record of the target. Records can be placed in an Archive as an Extended Action. When you take Chronicler, you gain one Archive.
For more details, see```Chronicler Archive List```

Choreographer.title: Choreographer

fields.value: Dance Form; Adept Acrobatics, Athletics, or Charm
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points
fields.name: Target

Choreographer.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Point and learns a Dance Move created by yourself. Choreographer may target a Pokémon multiple times.

Chitin Shield.title: Chitin Shield

fields.value: Insectoid Utility, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Bug-Type Pokémon is hit by a Status- Class Move
fields.name: Trigger

Chitin Shield.description: The effect misses, and your Pokemon becomes immune to that Move for the rest of the Scene. Chitin Shield may be triggered once per Scene per Pokemon.

Chemist.title: Chemist
Chemist.description: You may craft any Chemistry Recipe for which you qualify using your Chemistry Set.

Chemical Warfare.title: Chemical Warfare
Chemical Warfare.description: The Pester Ball creates a Blast 2, affecting all targets in the area.

Chef.title: Chef
Chef.description: You may use any Chef Recipe for which you qualify.

Cheers.title: Cheers
Cheers.description: The target or targets of the triggering [Orders] are Cheered for 1 full round. While Cheered, the target's Combat Stages cannot be lowered by foe's attacks, features, or abilities. This Feature costs 0 AP if the triggering effect affects only one ally, and costs 1 AP if it affects two or more.

Cheerleader.title: Cheerleader

fields.value: Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
fields.name: Target

Cheerleader.description: Your Pokémon loses 2 Tutor Points and gains the Friend Guard Ability.

Channeler.title: Channeler

fields.value: While Channeling a Pokémon, it may communicate its intentions, emotions, and motivations to you and you may communicate similarly with them; neither party may be deceitful in this exchange. You also become aware of all of its Moves, Abilities, and Capabilities. Allied Channeled Pokémon may always attempt Intercept Maneuvers for each other, regardless of Loyalty. If you are Fainted, you stop Channeling all Pokémon. Whenever you Channel a Pokémon, you have a vague knowledge of what has happened in the Pokémon’s past hour as if they were your own memories.
fields.name: Mechanic – Channeling

Channeler.description: You Channel the target Pokémon. If you attempt to Channel a Hostile Pokémon, you must make an Intuition Check with a DC of 15 to Channel the target. You may stop Channeling a Pokémon as a Free Action at any time. You may Channel a number of Pokémon at a time up to your Intuition Rank. If a Channeled Pokémon goes further than 20 meters from you, they stop being Channeled.

Channel the Dragon's Spirit.title: Channel the Dragon's Spirit
Channel the Dragon's Spirit.description: You may have the triggering attack deal Dragon- Type Damage if you wish. On 18+, all targets can only use At-Will Frequency Moves for one full round

Champion of Steel.title: Champion of Steel
Champion of Steel.description: The attack or Move increases your Defense by 1 Combat Stage on 16+ and you may have it deal Steel- Type Damage if you wish.

Champ in the Making.title: Champ in the Making

fields.value: Four Ace Trainer Feats, Master Command
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: You use Ace Trainer to give Pokémon Trained Stats
fields.name: Trigger

Champ in the Making.description: Choose two Trained Stats for each Pokémon instead of one. A Pokémon may only have two Trained Stats this way.

Chain Lightning.title: Chain Lightning

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging 1-target Electric Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Chain Lightning.description: Pick another Pokémon or Trainer within 3 meters of the target of the attack. You may repeat the triggering attack against the target, with a -5 Damage penalty. If you hit, you may repeat the attack a third time against a foe within 3 meters of the second target, this time with a -10 Damage penalty. The third target cannot be the same as the original target.

Celerity.title: Celerity

fields.value: A Flying-Type Pokémon, or a Pokémon with a Sky or Levitate Speed
fields.name: Target

Celerity.description: While this Feature is Bound, add your Type- Linked Skill to the target's Initiative. Additionally, if the Target uses a Disengage Maneuver, they may Shift as if Slowed instead of shifting only 1 Meter.

Cave Dweller.title: Cave Dweller – Cave Terrain
Cave Dweller.description: Your eyes are used to very low levels of light. You do not suffer Blindness for being in Low-Light conditions. If you would be Totally Blinded by complete darkness, you instead suffer the penalties of Blindness, and may make Survival Checks instead of Acrobatics to avoid becoming Tripped. You are immune to Stealth Rock Hazards.

Cavalier's Reprisal.title: Cavalier's Reprisal

fields.value: Ride as One, Expert Acrobatics or Athletics
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: An adjacent foe hits your Mount with an attack
fields.name: Trigger

Cavalier's Reprisal.description: You may make a Struggle Attack against the triggering foe.

Caustic Chemistry.title: Caustic Chemistry

fields.value: You hit with a Pester Ball or apply a Repel to a Pokémon
fields.name: Trigger

Caustic Chemistry.description: Make a Technology Education Roll. All targets affected by this Feature's trigger lose Hit Points equal to your roll. This may only affect a target once per Scene.

Case Specialist.title: Case Specialist

fields.value: You hit a target with a Poké Ball with a Spray, Flash, Bounce, or Zap Case applied to it.
fields.name: Trigger

Case Specialist.description:
The Case has additional effects according to its type(s).
»Spray Case
»Flash Case
»Bounce Case
»Zap Case

Captured Momentum.title: Captured Momentum
Captured Momentum.description:
Choose One Effect:
» You or your Pokémon gain a +2 bonus to their next Accuracy Roll during this combat.
» You subtract your highest Skill Rank out of Acrobatics, Athletics, Stealth, Survival, Guile, or Perception from your next Capture Roll during this combat.
» You gain 1 Temporary Action Point that disappears after one full round.

Capture Specialist.title: Capture Specialist

fields.value: Acrobatics, Athletics, Stealth, or Survival at Novice; Guile, or Perception at Novice
fields.name: Prerequisites

Capture Specialist.description: You gain two Capture Techniques of your choice, found on the next page. You must meet any prerequisites of the Technique.

Capsule Science.title: Capsule Science
Capsule Science.description:
You learn the Cap Cannon, Cap Ammo, and Wonder Launcher recipes, and you gain the following additional effects when using those items.
»Bean Caps
»Glue Caps
»Net Caps
» Wonder Launcher

Capricious Whirl.title: Capricious Whirl
Capricious Whirl.description: While this Feature is Bound, the target has a +3 bonus to its Evasion but deals 5 less damage with all damaging attacks.

Call the Dragon's Rage.title: Call the Dragon's Rage

fields.value: Bare the Dragon’s Claws, Master Com- mand or Intimidate
fields.name: Prerequisites

Call the Dragon's Rage.description: Your learn the Moves Dragon Claw and Dragon Tail. You may use these Moves as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.

Call The Current.title: Call The Current
Call The Current.description: You learn 2 Moves chosen from the list below, marked with the Rank of this Feature you are gaining or lower.

Calculated Assault.title: Calculated Assault

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Smart-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Calculated Assault.description: In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.

Cacophony.title: Cacophony

fields.value: Mt. Moon Blues, Adept Charm or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Cacophony.description: You learn the Moves Screech and Metal Sound.

Burst of Speed.title: Burst of Speed
Burst of Speed.description: Select an Initiative Count equal to half of your own Initiative or less; you may take an extra turn at that point in the round.

Burning Passion.title: Burning Passion

fields.value: Fire Bringer, Expert Focus or Combat
fields.name: Prerequisites

Burning Passion.description: Choose Flash Fire or Flame Body. You gain the chosen Ability.

Brutal Training.title: Brutal Training
Brutal Training.description: The target becomes Brutal until the end of the effect duration. Brutal Pokémon increase the Critical- Hit and Effect Range of all attacks by +1.

Broodlord.title: Broodlord

fields.value: Enhanced Embrace Rank 2, Expert Command or Survival
fields.name: Prerequisites

Broodlord.description: You gain the following Ability based on your Embrace:

Bring It On!.title: Bring It On!
Bring It On!.description:
You may trigger Bring It On! whenever...
» A Cheered Ally takes Damage, to grant them 5 Damage Reduction agains the triggering Damage.
» A Cheered Ally makes a Save Check, to grant them a +2 Bonus on that check.
» A Cheered Ally Takes a Breather, to grant them Temporary Hit Points equal to your Charm Rank. A target may benefit from each "Bring It On!" effect only once per Scene.

Brightest Flame.title: Brightest Flame
Brightest Flame.description: Your Pokémon's damaging Fire-Type Moves Burn their target on a roll of 18+. If a Move already has a chance to Burn a target, this Effect Range is instead increased by +3. Additionally, your Pokémon's damaging Fire-Type Moves deal additional damage equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank against Burned targets.

Breadth of Knowledge.title: Breadth of Knowledge

fields.value: General Research Field, Novice General Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Breadth of Knowledge.description: You gain three Skill Edges for which you qualify. These Edges must be used to gain a Skill Edge with an Education Skill, or to gain an Edge that has an Education Skill as a Prerequisite that you meet.

Brawler.title: Brawler

fields.value: Close Quarters Mastery, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon makes a Struggle Attack
fields.name: Trigger

Brawler.description: This Struggle Attack has a range of Burst 1, Friendly instead of the usual range, and deals Fighting- Type Damage.

Branded.title: Branded
Branded.description: You have made a contract with a deity or other supernatural being and have been Branded for it. This Brand may or may not be of your choosing. The other party will uphold their side of the deal and expects you to do the same. Other Legendaries may be wary to grant you Gifts in the future based on the contents of this contract. Your Patron Stats for this feature are those of the being you made your contract with. If this being was not a typical Legendary, its Patron Stats are its two highest base stats.

Brace for Impact.title: Brace for Impact
Brace for Impact.description: While this Feature is Bound, once a round, when the target uses a self-targeting Status Move, they may gain 5 Damage Reduction until the end of their next turn. They may also activate this effect as a Standard Action.

Bounce Shot.title: Bounce Shot
Bounce Shot.description: After hitting its mark or landing, your Poké Ball bounces 3 meters in any direction. You may have your Poké Ball trigger captures or releases before or after the bounce.

Bottled Lightning.title: Bottled Lightning

fields.value: An item made of conductive material
fields.name: Target

Bottled Lightning.description: Choose one of your Electric Type Moves with a target. You Charge the target item with this Move. Bot- tled Lightning counts as using the Move for frequency purposes. You may expend this Charge as a Swift Ac- tion on your turn to use the Move the item was charged with, originating from the item. If a Pokémon or Train- er touches a Charged item, you may instead activate this Swift Action as if it had the Priority keyword. At the end of a Scene, all items lose their Charge, and you may only have X items Charged at a time where X is half your Focus Rank.

Bookworm.title: Bookworm
Bookworm.description: You gain X Study Points, where X is equal to 2 plus one more for every other General Research Feature you have. You may Drain Study Points to benefit from studying Books, instead of Draining your Action Points. Study Points are restored to your maximum after an Extended Rest, just like Action Points.

Boo!.title: Boo!

fields.value: Ghost Step, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon reappears after using Ghost Step, or the set-up phase of Phantom Force or Shadow Force
fields.name: Trigger

Boo!.description: The next Ghost-Type attack the target makes that turn gains the Smite keyword and can't be Intercepted or avoided in any way (Dodge, Parry, Shield Moves, etc).

Body of Lightning.title: Body of Lightning

fields.value: Spark Master, Master Acrobatics or Focus
fields.name: Prerequisites

Body of Lightning.description: Choose Volt Absorb or Motor Drive. You gain the Chosen Ability.

Blur (Feature).title: Blur (Feature)
Blur (Feature).description: Attacks and Moves targeting you that don't require an Accuracy Check now require one, as though they had Accuracy Check of 2. You may only apply half of your Evasion to these Attacks and Moves.

Blazing Inferno.title: Blazing Inferno

fields.value: Fire Breather Rank 2, Master Focus or Combat
fields.name: Prerequisites

Blazing Inferno.description: You becoming Blazing. While you are Blaz- ing, whenever your Fire-Type Moves Inflict Burn, the Burned target immediately loses a Tick of Hit Points, and loses an additional Combat Stage in Defense. While Blazing, when you hit a foe with a damaging Fire-Type Move, you may choose to automatically burn one target of the Move. If you do, you lose the Blazing Condition after the Move's effects are resolved.

Black-Out Strike.title: Black-Out Strike

fields.value: Clever Ruse, Type-Linked Skill at Master
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Dark- Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Black-Out Strike.description: After the triggering attack is resolved, the target of the attack gains an Injury and falls asleep. If this attack would put them are 3 or more injuries or at or under 25% of their maximum Hit Points, the target instead becomes Fainted. Black-Out Strike may be used only once per Scene.

Bigger and Boulder.title: Bigger and Boulder

fields.value: Gravel Before Me, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Rock-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Bigger and Boulder.description: All targets hit by the triggering Move are pushed a number of meters equal to half your Type-Linked Skill Rank or less, and they become Vulnerable for one full round. Create a Stealth Rock Hazard adjacent to each foe hit this way.

Berserker.title: Berserker
Berserker.description: You learn the Moves Rage and Flail. You may use these moves as a Weapon Attack when wielding Melee Weapons.

Beguiling Dance.title: Beguiling Dance
Beguiling Dance.description: When creating Dance Moves, you can choose to create a Dance Move that has Range: 4, 1 Target, AC 3, and lowers a Combat Stat (chosen at creation) by -2 Combat Stages. This Move is otherwise the same as other Dance Moves you could create except that Dance Moves created with this template have the Contest Effect Excitement instead of Get Ready!.

Beautiful Ballet.title: Beautiful Ballet
Beautiful Ballet.description: Your Pokémon with at least 3d6 in their Beauty Stat from Poffins may activate Beautiful Ballet as a Standard Action to perform one of the following Moves. They must still follow frequency limits as usual for these Moves.

Battle Synchronization.title: Battle Synchronization
Battle Synchronization.description: For one full round, whenever a Channeled Pokémon successfully hits a foe, all Channeled Pokémon » gain +1 Accuracy and +1 Evasion against that foe for the duration of this Feature.

Battle Conductor.title: Battle Conductor

fields.value: You give [Orders] with a Frequency of At-Will that have targets
fields.name: Trigger

Battle Conductor.description: You may target up to two additional Allies with the [Orders].

Bare the Dragon's Claws.title: Bare the Dragon's Claws

fields.value: Herald of Pride, Adept Command or Intimidate
fields.name: Prerequisites

Bare the Dragon's Claws.description: Your learn the Moves Dragon Claw and Dragon Tail. You may use these Moves as Weapon Attacks when wielding Melee Weapons.

Bag of Tricks.title: Bag of Tricks
Bag of Tricks.description: You gain two Trickster Techniques of your choice, found on the next page.

Backpacker.title: Backpacker
Backpacker.description: You gain the Skill Enhancement Edge. You then gain an instance of the Skill Stunt Edge for each of the two Skills you chose with Skill Enhancement.

Awareness.title: Awareness

fields.value: Enduring Soul, 3 Pokémon with a Defensive Ability
fields.name: Prerequisites

Awareness.description: Your Pokémon add +2 to all Save Checks.

Authentic Thaumaturgy.title: Authentic Thaumaturgy
Authentic Thaumaturgy.description: You may apply a Rank 2 Power Manipulation to your attack.

Aura Reader (Feature).title: Aura Reader (Feature)
Aura Reader (Feature).description: You gain the Aura Reader Capability for the rest of the scene. If your Intuition is Adept Rank or higher, you also gain the Aura Pulse Capability.

Aura Mastery.title: Aura Mastery
Aura Mastery.description: Choose two of Aura Sphere, Focus Blast, Drain Punch, or Focus Punch. You learn the chosen Moves.

Aura Guardian.title: Aura Guardian
Aura Guardian.description: Choose two of Detect, Vacuum Wave, or Force Palm. You learn the chosen Moves.

Athletic Moves.title: Athletic Moves
Athletic Moves.description: You learn two Athlete Moves marked with the Rank of this Feature you are taking or lower.

Athlete.title: Athlete

fields.value: Novice Athletics, One of Athletic Prowess, Mounted Prowess, Power Boost, Stamina, or Swimmer
fields.name: Prerequisites

Athlete.description: After an hour of exercise, an Athlete may choose two different Stats besides HP; both of those stats become Trained Stats. The default State of Trained Stats is +1 Combat Stages instead of 0. An Athlete may have two Trained Stats at a time.

Assault Armor.title: Assault Armor

fields.value: Polished Shine, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Steel-Type Pokémon hits with a Steel-Type attack
fields.name: Trigger

Assault Armor.description: Your Pokémon may add its Defense Stat to their Damage Roll in place of the attack's normal offensive stat.

Arctic Zeal.title: Arctic Zeal

fields.value: Glacial Ice, Type-Linked Skill at Expert
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Ice-Type Pokémon uses an Ice-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Arctic Zeal.description:
Your Pokémon uses the Move Mist as if it were on their Move List. When used this way, in addition to its normal effects, your Ice-Type Pokémon may expend uses of the Mist Blessing to do the following:
» As a Swift Action on their turn to cause a foe within 5 meters to take a -5 penalty to Damage Rolls and become Slowed for one full round.
» As a Free Action when being hit by a Fighting, Fire,Rock, or Steel-Typed attack dealing Super-Effective Damage to add their Tick Value to their Damage Reduction gained from Glacial Ice.
» As a Swift Action on their turn to increase their Defense or Special Defense by 1 Combat Stage.

Arctic Pilgrim.title: Arctic Pilgrim – Tundra Terrain
Arctic Pilgrim.description: Neither deep, slow, nor slippery ice can deter you. You are immune to the effects of Hail and to the Frozen condition, and gain 5 Damage Reduction against Ice- Type attacks.

Archive Tutor.title: Archive Tutor
Archive Tutor.description: Select a Record in your Technique Archive that is of a Move that the target can learn by Level Up, TM or by Move Tutor. The target learns the Move and loses 2 Tutor Points. You can target someone else's Pokémon only once with Archive Tutor; you may target your own Pokémon any number of times with Archive Tutor, but they must still abide by any Move Pool Limitations (ie: no more than 3 of the user's Move Pool can come from TMs or Tutor Moves).

Archival Training.title: Archival Training
Archival Training.description: Each Rank, you gain an Archive.

Arcanist.title: Arcanist
Arcanist.description:
You create a Soul Bond with the target Weapon. You may make a Soul Bond with only one weapon at a time. If you create a new Soul Bond, previously Soul Bound weapons lose the Bond. Soul Bound Weapons gain the following benefits:
»Increase the Damage Base and Effect Range of Struggle Attacks and Arcane Weapon Moves made with your Soul Bonded Weapon by +1 for each Occult Education Rank you have above Novice, up to a maximum of +3 at Master Rank.
»As a Shift Action, you may beckon your Soul Bonded Weapon to your hands if it is within 10 meters. If it is being held by someone else who does not want to let go of the weapon, make an Occult vs Athletics Opposed Check. If you win, they their lose grip on your Weapon and it flies to your hand as normal

Arcane Training.title: Arcane Training

fields.value: Novice Occult Education, Elemental Connection or Mystic Senses
fields.name: Prerequisites

Arcane Training.description: You may use Arcane Weapons. Attacks made with your Arcane Weapons share the Type of your Elemental Connection. If you have Mystic Senses, these Attacks deal Normal Type Damage. Arcane Weapon users that qualified through Mystic Senses or Elemental Connection (Normal) gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls and a +2 Bonus to Effect Range when using Arcane Weapon Attacks. When wielding an Arcane Weapon, you may resist Disarm Maneuvers with your Occult Education.

Arcane Favor.title: Arcane Favor

fields.value: Fairy Lights, Type-Linked Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

fields.value: Your Pokémon uses a Fairy-Type Move
fields.name: Trigger

Arcane Favor.description: Your Pokémon and all allies on the Field gain a +1 Bonus to all rolls for one full round.

Aqua Vortex.title: Aqua Vortex

fields.value: Your Pokémon hits with a damaging Water-Type attack
fields.name: Trigger

Aqua Vortex.description: All targets of the attack are put in a Vortex, and take a penalty to all Damage Rolls equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank while in the Vortex.

Apparition.title: Apparition

fields.value: Elemental Connection (Ghost), Novice Intimidate, Novice Occult Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Apparition.description: When wielding Melee Weapons, you may use Occult Education or Intimidate instead of Combat to determine the Damage Base of your Struggle Attacks, to resist Disarm Maneuvers, and to qualify for a Weapon's Moves. Your Weapon Attacks always treat you as having the Reach Capability, and foes may not activate Reaction effects against them that specify being hit by a Melee Attack.

Apothecary.title: Apothecary

fields.value: Apothecary Research Field, Novice Medicine Education
fields.name: Prerequisites

Apothecary.description: You gain use of any Apothecary Recipe for which you qualify.

Ancient Heritage.title: Ancient Heritage

fields.value: Your Fossil Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining
fields.name: Target

Ancient Heritage.description: The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns Ancient Power. If the target has Ancient Power in its Level-Up List, Ancient Heritage costs no Tutor Points. As a static effect, whenever your Pokémon use Ancient Power, its activated effect occurs on 18+ and you may always choose whether it deals Physical or Special Damage, using the appropriate attack Stat.

Ambient Aura.title: Ambient Aura

fields.value: You use a Move with the Aura keyword
fields.name: Trigger

Ambient Aura.description:
You gain an Aura Blessing that can be spent any time as a Free Action Interrupt. When you spend an Aura Blessing, you choose one of the effects below. You may only have one Aura Blessing at a time, and you must have the Aura Pulse Capability to use Ambient Aura.
» You create an energy barrier around you or an ally within 5 meters granting Damage Reduction equal to your Intuition Rank tripled until the end of your next turn.
» You cure yourself of a Volatile Status Affliction.
» Gain the Blindsense Capability until the end of the Scene.

Alarm Runes.title: Alarm Runes

fields.value: A Glyph you have put down, regardless of distance
fields.name: Target

Alarm Runes.description: You give the Glyph a Trigger, which may be as vague or as precise as you like (i.e.: "If anyone enters the room", "if James peeks in my diary", "If a Torkoal uses Surf while I scream the word 'Gelato'"). If the trigger is met within the Rune's 30 meters, the Rune will become visible, and will begin screeching loudly, alerting any- one nearby. You are capable of hearing this screeching noise in your head, regardless of your current distance. Glyphs will remember their Triggers as long as the AP spent on the Feature is Bound. If you have the Explosive Runes or Sentry Runes Features, you may instruct this Glyph to automatically use the chosen Feature as a Free Action when it is triggered if you have the AP to spend. You may have only one Glyph use Explosive Runes per round, even if multiple Runes are triggered at the same time.

Aiming Down The Sights.title: Aiming Down The Sights
Aiming Down The Sights.description: Your next Weapon Attack with a long-range Weapon gains +2 to its Accuracy Roll and Critical Hit Range. This effect lasts until used or until the start of your next turn.

Agility Training.title: Agility Training
Agility Training.description: The target becomes Agile until the end of the effect duration. Agile Pokémon gain a +1 bonus to Movement Capabilities and +4 to Initiative.

Affliction Techniques.title: Affliction Techniques

fields.value: You use a Antidote, Burn Heal, Ice Heal, or Paralyze Heal
fields.name: Trigger

Affliction Techniques.description:
If the target successfully cures the target of its linked Status Affliction, the item has additional effects.
»Antidote: The target gains +1 Special Defense Combat Stage.
» Burn Heal The target gains +1 Defense Combat Stage.
»Ice Heal: The target gains +1 Attack or Special Attack Combat Stage
»Paralyze Heal:The target gains +1 Speed Combat Stage.

Aerialist.title: Aerialist
Aerialist.description: You learn the Moves Aerial Ace and Splash.

Advanced Capture Techniques.title: Advanced Capture Techniques

fields.value: Capture Specialist, any 2 Skills at Adept Rank
fields.name: Rank 2 Prerequisites

fields.value: Capture Specialist, any 2 Skills at Expert Rank
fields.name: Rank 3 Prerequisites

fields.value: Capture Specialist, any 3 Skills at Expert Rank
fields.name: Rank 4 Prerequisites

Advanced Capture Techniques.description: At each Rank, you gain two Capture Techniques of your choice, found on the next page. You must meet any prerequisites of the Technique. You may qualify for Advanced Capture Techniques' prerequisites with the Acrobatics, Athletics, Stealth, Survival, Guile, or Perception Skills only.

Adrenaline Rush.title: Adrenaline Rush

fields.value: You are lowered to half or your Maximum Hit Points or less
fields.name: Trigger

Adrenaline Rush.description: You gain +1 Combat Stage in each of your Trained Stats, are cured of up to two Status Afflictions, and gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points. Adrenaline Rush may be used only once per Scene

Adaptive Geography.title: Adaptive Geography

fields.value: You or your Pokémon gain Initiative
fields.name: Trigger

Adaptive Geography.description: The triggering target takes their turn as if they were in a terrain adjacent to the terrain they are in on the following graphic. For example, if you are standing in Wetlands terrain, you may act as if you are standing in Forest or Ocean Terrain. This affects Survivalist Features, Naturewalk Capabilities, Moves with the Environ Keyword, etc.

Adaptable Performance.title: Adaptable Performance

fields.value: Your Pokémon's Turn to use a Move in a Contest
fields.name: Trigger

Adaptable Performance.description: Choose two of your Pokémon's Moves. Your Pokémon may perform your Contest Move as if had the Contest Typing of one of your chosen Moves, and had the effects of the other. You may not use either move on the next round of the contest. This effect may be used once per Contest.

Action Hero Stunt.title: Action Hero Stunt

fields.value: Your Pokémon makes a Skill Check for a dramatic, high risk action
fields.name: Trigger

Action Hero Stunt.description: Instead of using a Skill for this Check, your Pokémon rolls their Cool Dice from Poffins and adds their number of Cool Dice from Stats as a modifier. For example, a Pokémon with 5d6 Cool from Poffins and 2d6 from Attack rolls 5d6+2. Skill Checks invoked by Intercepting attacks, Combat Maneuvers, Moves, and Abilities don't trigger this Feature.

Ace Trainer.title: Ace Trainer

fields.value: You spend at least half an hour Training your Pokémon
fields.name: Trigger

Ace Trainer.description: For each Pokémon that has been Trained during this time, choose a Stat besides HP; that Stat becomes Trained until an Extended Rest is taken. The default State of Trained Stats is +1 Combat Stages instead of 0. A Pokémon may have only one Trained Stat at a time.

Accessorize.title: Accessorize

fields.value: Dashing Makeover, one Fashionista Skill at Adept
fields.name: Prerequisites

Accessorize.description: You may wear and benefit from two Accessory Slot Items at once. The two items must be of different types and must not share an effect. For example, a Fire Brace cannot be paired with another Fire Brace or a Fire Plate, but it could be paired with an Ice Brace, a Fire Booster, or a Stat Booster.

Accentuated Taste.title: Accentuated Taste
Accentuated Taste.description:
Whenever you create a Snack with a Chef Feature, you may assign it a Taste chosen from Salty, Sour, Spicy, Dry, and Sweet. Tasty Snacks must be assigned their corresponding Taste. Whenever a Pokémon trades in a Digestion Buff from a Snack with an assigned Taste they do not dislike, they gain the following bonuses:
» Salty
» Spicy
» Sour
» Dry
» Bitter
